name: Feedzai
tagline: AI-native fraud and financial crime prevention platform for major banks
summary: Feedzai builds real-time fraud and AML detection for large financial institutions. The platform processes 70 billion events annually and protects over 1 billion consumers across 90+ countries. Valued at $2B after $75M Series E (Oct 2025). Selected by ECB as first-ranked tenderer for digital euro fraud prevention. Acquired DemystData for $157M (April 2025). Mastercard strategic partner.

name: Sardine
tagline: AI risk platform for fraud, credit, and compliance
summary: Sardine offers fraud prevention and compliance automation using device intelligence and behavior biometrics. Serves 300+ customers in 70+ countries including FIS, Deel, GoDaddy, and X. Raised $145M total ($70M Series C led by Activant Capital, 2025) from a16z, Activant, Visa, Experian, Moody's, and FIS. Hit 130% YoY ARR growth in 2024 and built one of the largest device fingerprint databases (2.2B+ devices).

name: Hawk AI
tagline: AI-powered AML and fraud detection for banks and fintechs
summary: Hawk builds AML transaction monitoring and fraud detection for banks and payment companies. Serves 80+ customers ranging from Tier 1 banks to fintechs, including Worldline, VakifBank, and Vodafone. Raised $134M+ total including $100M Series B expansion (June 2024) and $56M Series C (April 2025) from One Peak, BlackFin, Macquarie, and Rabobank. Product suite covers payment screening, transaction monitoring, and customer risk rating.

name: Resistant AI
tagline: AI models for document fraud and financial crime prevention
summary: Resistant AI detects forged and manipulated documents in financial onboarding and underwriting workflows. The platform analyzes how documents are constructed rather than their content, making it language-agnostic. Serves 100+ customers including Payoneer, Dun & Bradstreet, and AXA. Raised $25M Series B (Oct 2025) led by DTCP with Experian, GV, Notion Capital. Reached breakeven Sept 2025. Claims 10x ARR growth since Series A, with 150M+ documents verified.

name: Flagright
tagline: AI-native transaction monitoring and AML compliance
summary: Flagright provides no-code AML compliance software for fintechs and smaller banks. YC W22 backed, raised $7.6M total including $4.3M seed (March 2025) led by Frontline Ventures. Offices in Berlin, London, NYC, SF, Singapore, Bangalore. Ranked #37 on Sifted 250 (2025) as Europe's fastest-growing AML compliance company. Customers report 93% fewer false positives and 87% reduction in manual monitoring.

name: Tookitaki
tagline: AI with community-driven intelligence for AML and fraud
summary: Tookitaki combines AML software with a federated learning network where financial institutions share fraud typologies without exposing raw data. The AFC Ecosystem consortium adds a new financial crime pattern roughly every two days. Acquired by Thunes. Has monitored 10B+ transactions across 100M consumers. Raised $57.7M total; customers include Maya (Philippines' largest digital bank) and Australian community banks.

name: Alloy
tagline: Identity decisioning platform with 160+ data sources
summary: Alloy offers an identity decisioning platform that aggregates 160+ data sources for KYC, fraud prevention, and credit underwriting. Valued at $1.55B (Sept 2022). Serves banks, credit unions, and fintechs. $42.4M revenue in 2024. Investors include Lightspeed, Bessemer, Canapi, and Felicis. Customer results: Earnest increased auto-approval 56%, Mountain America CU cut fraud 29%.

name: Unit21
summary: Unit21 provides a no-code platform for fraud and AML operations, letting compliance teams build detection rules without engineering support. Raised $92M from Google, Tiger Global, and others at a $300M valuation. Customers include Intuit, Line, and Bakkt. Kinecta FCU blocked $70K in fraud in one weekend using the platform. Recent AI features include automated alert triage (Nexo hit 57% automation) and ML-powered rule recommendations.

name: TRM Labs
summary: TRM Labs provides blockchain intelligence for crypto compliance and investigations. Tracks 200M+ assets across 100 blockchains with 2.4B+ labeled addresses. Raised $150M from Thoma Bravo, Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, Visa, Citi, PayPal, and Tiger Global. Revenue hit $11.3M in 2024. Customers include government agencies (HMRC, FCA, IRS), exchanges, and financial institutions. Competes with Chainalysis for enterprise blockchain analytics.

name: Chainalysis
summary: Chainalysis is the market leader in blockchain analytics, serving 1,500+ customers including the FBI, IRS, DEA, Coinbase, and Revolut. Projecting $250M ARR for 2024 (up 30% YoY), with 70%+ of revenue from government contracts. Raised $536M total; valued at $2.5B (down from $8.6B peak). Products include Reactor for investigations and KYT for compliance. Not yet profitable but holds ~$200M cash. The dominant player but facing private-sector churn.

name: Socure
tagline: Digital identity verification and fraud prevention
summary: Socure is a leading identity verification platform valued at $4.5B. Processed 2.7B identity requests in 2024 (2x YoY growth) covering 370M unique identities. Serves 2,800+ customers including 13 US states and federal agencies. Achieved 54% YoY GAAP revenue growth. Acquired Effectiv (Oct 2024) to expand into payments fraud and AML. Named a Leader in Gartner's 2024 Magic Quadrant for ID verification.

name: iDenfy
tagline: AI-driven identity verification with 4D biometric detection
summary: iDenfy offers identity verification combining AI biometrics with human review for KYC compliance. Serves 500+ customers including Bank of Lithuania, Juni, and Xcoins. Raised $1.1M (March 2025). €2.4M revenue in 2022. Added bank verification connecting to 2,500+ banks across 29 countries. Featured in G2's Winter 2024 report as leading identity verification solution.

name: Darwinium
tagline: Real-time fraud detection across digital interactions
summary: Darwinium runs fraud detection at the network edge using CDN infrastructure (Cloudflare, AWS CloudFront) for real-time decisioning. Founded by Alisdair Faulkner and Reed Taussig (sold ThreatMetrix for $817M in 2018). Raised $28M total ($18M Series A in 2023) from USVP, Blackbird, and Airtree. Targets fintech, ecommerce, and gaming verticals.

name: Greenlite
tagline: AI agents that accelerate AML reviews
summary: Greenlite builds AI agents that automate KYC, AML, and sanctions compliance workflows. Y Combinator-backed; raised $20M total ($15M Series A from Greylock and Thomson Reuters in 2025). Customers include Ramp, Mercury, Betterment, and Grasshopper Bank. Claims 3-4x ROI within 12 weeks and 70% reduction in repetitive compliance work. Serves OCC, FDIC, and SEC-regulated institutions.

name: Upstart
tagline: AI lending platform using alternative data for credit decisions
summary: Upstart operates an AI lending marketplace connecting borrowers to 100+ bank and credit union partners. Public company (UPST) that hit $219M revenue in Q4 2024 (+56% YoY) and near-breakeven. 91% of loans fully automated; model analyzes 2,500+ variables and approves 44% more borrowers at 36% lower APRs vs. traditional scoring. Q4 2024 saw $2.1B in originations (+68% YoY). Auto loan segment growing 46% QoQ.

name: Zest AI
tagline: AI-automated underwriting for credit unions and banks
summary: Zest AI provides ML-based credit underwriting software for banks and credit unions. Raised $200M from Insight Partners in 2024; serves nearly 300 lenders including Citi, Truist, and First National Bank of Omaha. Has deployed 500+ proprietary credit models with 50+ patents. Claims 25% approval lift with no added risk and 20% default reduction. Forbes Fintech 50 (2024). Recent customer-led round included SchoolsFirst FCU and Citi Ventures.

name: Pagaya
tagline: AI-driven financial network connecting banks to lending
summary: Pagaya operates an AI lending network connecting 31 bank partners (including US Bank, OneMain, and a top-5 US bank) to 150+ institutional investors. Public company (PGY) with $1.03B revenue in 2024 (+27% YoY). Largest personal loan ABS issuer in the US ($25B+ raised across 62 deals). Uses AI to approve loans declined by partner banks. Acquired Theorem Technology in 2024, bringing AUM to $3B+.

name: Scienaptic AI
tagline: AI credit decisioning platform for financial institutions
summary: Scienaptic provides an AI credit decisioning platform focused on expanding access for underserved borrowers. Serves 145+ lenders collectively managing $3.9T in assets; processes 3M+ decisions monthly worth $3B+. Strong in credit unions—CUSO backed by 15 strategic CU investors. Has processed $76B+ in applications. Claims 2,000% growth over three years. Also operates in India with customers like TVS Credit and BharatPe.

name: Underwrite.ai
tagline: AI underwriting and credit risk modeling for lenders
summary: Underwrite.ai provides API-based credit risk scoring using ML techniques adapted from genomics research. Bootstrapped company. Delivers decisions in 2-3ms. Serves community banks, credit unions, and P2P platforms. Models are lender-specific and continuously retrained. Founder Marc Stein previously built underwriting systems at JPMorgan Chase and Freedom Debt Relief. Expanding into emerging markets via DEFINE Initiative partnership.

name: FinbotsAI
tagline: AI credit scoring platform for emerging markets
summary: FinbotsAI builds AI credit scoring infrastructure for emerging market lenders. Raised $3.5M Series A (2022) from Accel. MAS Veritas and IMDA AI Verify validated. CreditX platform serves digital banks, SME lenders, and credit bureaus across 16+ countries in APAC, Middle East, and Africa. Clients include KBZ Bank (Myanmar's largest private bank), Fintech Galaxy (Middle East), and Worldline. Won IFC Global SME Finance Forum 'Product Innovation of the Year' (2024).

name: Kaaj
tagline: Agentic AI for small-business lending automation
summary: Kaaj deploys AI agents to automate small business loan underwriting, compressing days of manual work into under 3 minutes. Raised $3.8M seed from Kindred Ventures and Better Tomorrow Ventures in 2025. Has processed $5B+ in applications for customers including Amur Equipment Finance. Targeting the $1.7T US small-business and $1.3T equipment finance markets. Claims lenders can 4x application volume without adding headcount.

name: Lendbuzz
tagline: AI auto financing for underserved populations
summary: Lendbuzz offers AI-powered auto loans for thin-file and immigrant borrowers underserved by traditional lenders. Raised $310M+ equity plus $2B in credit facilities, including $345M round (2023) at $1.1B valuation. Profitable since 2024; $329M revenue and $22M net income (year ending June 2025). Works through 5,000+ dealer partners. Filed S-1 (Sept 2025) for NASDAQ IPO targeting ~$1.5B valuation. Backed by Group 1001 and 83North.

name: CredoLab
tagline: Alternative credit scoring using smartphone data
summary: CredoLab provides alternative credit scores using consented smartphone metadata (50K+ data points per user). Serves 49 financial institutions across 14 countries with 10M+ loan applicants processed. Raised $7M Series A led by GBG. Expanding into Latin America, Africa, and India. Clients report 48% more approvals with 39% less risk. Key customers include Sun Finance and CrediOrbe (Colombia's largest 2-wheeler lender).

name: Ocrolus
tagline: AI document automation for lending decisions
summary: Ocrolus provides AI document processing for lenders, extracting data from bank statements, pay stubs, and tax forms with 99%+ accuracy. Serves 500+ customers including PayPal, Brex, SoFi, and CrossCountry Mortgage. Raised $142M total ($80M Series C at $500M+ valuation, 2021). Processes lending documents for small business, consumer, and mortgage verticals. Customer Lendr cut processing time from hours to 12 minutes with $560K+ annual savings. Launched mortgage solution Inspect in 2024.

name: Stripe
tagline: AI-powered payments platform with fraud detection
summary: Stripe is the dominant payments infrastructure platform, processing $1.4T in volume in 2024 (up 38% YoY). Hit $5.1B revenue (up 28%) and $2.2B free cash flow. Valued at $91.5B in early 2025 (approaching its $95B 2021 peak). Serves half the Fortune 100, 80% of Forbes Cloud 100, and 78% of Forbes AI 50. Owns 68% of US e-commerce payment processing. Revenue and Finance Automation Suite hit $500M run rate. First profitable year in 2024.

name: Ramp
tagline: AI-powered corporate cards and spend management
summary: Ramp offers corporate cards and spend management software, now valued at $32B (Nov 2025) with $1B+ ARR and $100B+ in annual payment volume. Revenue doubled YoY; serves 50,000+ customers including Shopify, Figma, Notion, Anduril, and CBRE. Enterprise segment grew 133% with 2,200+ enterprise customers. Raised $2.3B total. Overtook Brex in TPV by 2024. Dual revenue model: interchange fees plus SaaS subscriptions for AP automation and expense tools.

name: Brex
tagline: AI corporate card and financial stack for startups
summary: Brex provides corporate cards and financial software targeting startups and enterprises. Valued at $12.3B; ~$700M ARR (Aug 2025) with 50% YoY growth. Serves 1 in 3 US startups and 150+ public companies including Anthropic, Scale AI, and DoorDash. Enterprise grew 91% in 2024 with 130%+ NRR. On track to be cash-flow positive by mid-2025. Raised $1.5B+ total from Greenoaks, DST Global, Kleiner Perkins, and Y Combinator.

name: Natural
tagline: Payments infrastructure for AI agent transactions
summary: Natural is building payments infrastructure for the AI agent economy. Raised $9.8M seed co-led by Abstract and Human Capital with Forerunner, Terrain, and founders from Bridge, Mercury, and Ramp. Enables agents to send, receive, and manage payments with businesses, consumers, and other agents. McKinsey projects agentic commerce at $3-5T globally within 5 years. Legacy rails can't handle machine-speed transactions.

name: Catena Labs
tagline: Building payment rails for AI agents
summary: Catena Labs is building the first AI-native financial institution. Raised $18M seed (May 2025) led by a16z crypto with Breyer, Circle, Coinbase, CoinFund, and angels including Tom Brady. Founded by Sean Neville (Circle co-founder, USDC co-creator). Open-sourced Agent Commerce Kit (ACK) for identity, payments, receipts. Stablecoin-based rails with near-instant settlement. Gartner: 30% of economic activity will involve autonomous agents by 2030.

name: Betterment
tagline: Pioneer robo-advisor with AI portfolio management
summary: Betterment pioneered the robo-advisor category starting in 2008. Manages $65B+ AUM for 1M+ accounts as of late 2025. Valued at ~$1.3B. Acquired Goldman Sachs' Marcus Invest (April 2024), Ellevest automated investing ($1.1B AUM, Feb 2025), and Rowboat Advisors for direct indexing (May 2025). High-yield cash account drove growth as rates climbed. Raised $435M total. Competes with Wealthfront for mass-affluent millennials seeking automated tax-loss harvesting and diversified portfolios.

name: Wealthfront
tagline: Automated investment platform with tax optimization
summary: Wealthfront offers automated investing and high-yield cash accounts. IPO'd on Nasdaq (WLTH) in Dec 2025 at $14/share, ~$2.05B valuation. Manages $88B+ in assets for 1.3M+ clients with $339M revenue and $194M net income (FY2025). Cash account (5%+ APY) drives ~60% of revenue. 95% client retention with 120%+ net revenue retention. Founded in 2008, raised $274M pre-IPO. Direct competitor to Betterment in the robo space.

name: QuantConnect
summary: QuantConnect provides an open-source cloud platform for building and deploying algorithmic trading strategies. Community of 200K+ quants from 170+ countries. Processes $45B+ in notional volume per month with 375K+ live strategies deployed since 2012. Backed by Uncorrelated Ventures and Start-Up Chile. Supports equities, FX, futures, options, and crypto. Runs monthly competitions to recruit talent and allocate capital.

name: Composer
tagline: AI trading strategy builder without code
summary: Composer lets retail investors build, backtest, and automate trading strategies using natural language and a no-code interface. Powers $215M+ in automated trades daily across stocks, crypto, and options. Launched 'Trade with AI' in 2025, turning prompts into executable strategies in under 60 seconds. Raised $16.7M from First Round Capital, Golden Ventures, and Left Lane Capital. Targets DIY investors who want algorithmic trading without coding. Built proprietary trading language for LLM integration.

name: Trade Ideas
tagline: AI-powered trading signals with Holly AI
summary: Trade Ideas provides AI-powered stock scanning and trading signals via Holly AI. Holly analyzes millions of scenarios nightly and recommends 3-10 intraday trades per day with entry/exit signals. 60+ proprietary strategies. Integrates with Interactive Brokers, E*TRADE, eSignal for execution. Bootstrapped since 2002; recognized on Inc. 5000 for multiple years. Win rate of 55-65% with risk-adjusted returns beating S&P 500.

name: PortfolioPilot
summary: PortfolioPilot is an AI-powered financial advisor with $30B+ in tracked assets and 40K+ users (2025). Raised $4M total including $2M seed (2024) from Morado Ventures, NEA Angel Fund, and Unpopular Ventures. Targets $100K-$5M investable assets. Does not take custody—provides portfolio recommendations. Received $175K SEC fine (2024) over AI marketing claims as part of first 'AI washing' enforcement action.

name: Tegus
summary: Tegus provides expert interview transcripts and financial models for investment research. Acquired by AlphaSense for $930M (July 2024) in cash and stock. Had 3,000+ investment manager customers, trusted by 95% of top 20 PE firms. Library of 150K+ transcripts covering 35K+ companies. Raised $112M before acquisition. Charged $300-400/call vs. $1K+ at legacy networks, with subscriptions starting at $20-25K/seat.

name: AlphaSense
summary: AlphaSense provides AI-powered market intelligence search across documents, transcripts, and filings. Hit $500M ARR (Oct 2025), doubling in 18 months. Valued at $4B after $650M Series E (June 2024). Serves 6,500+ customers including 88% of S&P 100, Google, JPMorgan, and Microsoft. Acquired Tegus for $930M (July 2024). Average deal size grew from $28K to $66K ARR. Strong in asset management, consulting, and pharma. Planning IPO.

name: Sentieo (Now AlphaSense)
tagline: AI financial data and research platform
summary: Sentieo was an AI-powered financial research platform acquired by AlphaSense. Combined document search, financial modeling, and alternative data. Served hedge funds, asset managers, and corporate teams. After acquisition, Sentieo's capabilities were integrated into AlphaSense's broader market intelligence platform. The combined entity now serves 6,500+ customers and has $500M+ ARR.

name: Trumid
summary: Trumid operates one of the three largest electronic credit trading platforms in the US. Hit $1T+ traded volume in 2024. Over 1,400 traders from ~1,000 institutions trade IG, HY, distressed, and EM bonds on the platform. Q3 2024 ADV up 68% YoY with 25% market share gain. Raised $722M+ total including $208M Series E (2021) at $2.4B valuation from Motive Partners, Senator, TPG, BlackRock, and T. Rowe Price. Modernizing voice-based credit markets.

name: Tickeron
summary: Tickeron provides AI-powered pattern recognition and trading signals for retail investors. Platform scans thousands of stocks, ETFs, and forex pairs for 39+ chart patterns. Uses proprietary Financial Learning Models (FLMs) for predictive analytics. Launched AI Multi-Agents with 5-minute trading cycles claiming up to 364% annualized returns. Led by CEO Sergey Savastiouk (PhD). Targets retail traders and small funds who lack in-house quant capabilities.

name: TrendSpider
summary: TrendSpider is an automated technical analysis platform with 15K+ active traders. Founded 2016 in Chicago by Dan Ushman (CEO) and Ruslan Lagutin (CTO). Features patented multi-timeframe analysis, 200+ indicators, and AI Strategy Lab with no-code ML model training. Pricing at $107-197/month. Includes cloud-based bots for automated execution. Uses Claude 3.7 for AI assistant. Serves retail traders seeking institutional-grade tools.

name: alphaAI
summary: alphaAI is a next-gen robo-advisor with adaptive, rules-based portfolio management. Launched public beta Oct 2024. ML models trained on 10B+ data points from 10K+ global stocks. Four dynamic modes (Surge, Steady, Cautious, Defense) adjust to market conditions. $100 minimum investment. SEC-registered fiduciary. Supports leveraged/inverse ETFs. Founded by former Wall Street hedge fund analyst Richard Sun.

name: Lemonade
summary: Lemonade is a public AI-first insurer (LMND) offering renters, home, pet, car, and life coverage. Hit $527M revenue in 2024 with $944M in-force premium (+26% YoY). First cash-flow positive year in 2024. Gross profit up 90% YoY; loss ratio hit record low of 63%. Claims 2,000 customers per employee vs. 150-450 industry average. 2025 guidance: $655-657M revenue with 28% IFP growth.

name: Shift Technology
tagline: AI fraud detection for insurance claims
summary: Shift Technology provides AI-powered claims fraud detection for insurers. Valued at $1B+ after $220M Series D led by Advent International. Serves P&C, health, life, and travel insurers in 30+ countries with 3B+ policies/claims analyzed. Customers include Tokio Marine, Direct Assurance, and Markerstudy. 2024 Celent Luminary Award winner in both P&C and Health. Uses Azure OpenAI for document analysis. Offices in Paris, Boston, Tokyo, Singapore.

name: Akur8
tagline: AI pricing and reserving for insurers
summary: Akur8 provides ML-powered pricing and reserving tools for insurers. Raised $120M Series C in 2024 at $400M valuation from One Peak and Partners Group; $180M total funding. Hit $20.5M revenue in 2024 (doubled YoY). Serves 350 customers across 40+ countries including AXA, Generali, Munich Re, and Tokio Marine. 3,000+ actuaries use the platform daily. Acquired Milliman's Arius reserving platform.

name: Corvus (Travelers)
summary: Corvus is a cyber insurance MGA acquired by Travelers for $435M in January 2024. Founded 2017 in Boston. Built proprietary AI-driven cyber risk platform for underwriting and threat assessment. Had raised $147M+ from Bain Capital Ventures and .406 Ventures before exit. Book of business exceeded $200M premium. All products now on Travelers E&S paper. Combines real-time risk scanning with policy coverage for SMBs and mid-market.

name: NEXT Insurance (ERGO)
summary: NEXT Insurance provides digital commercial insurance for small businesses. Hit $548M revenue in 2024; serves 600K+ businesses. Raised $1.1B total pre-acquisition. Acquired by Munich Re's ERGO for $2.6B (completed Q3 2025). Rebranded as ERGO NEXT. Integrated with Intuit, Gusto, Square, and Toast through AP Intego acquisition. Offers GL, workers comp, commercial auto, and professional liability.

name: Coterie Insurance
tagline: AI quotes for small business in 60 seconds
summary: Coterie provides instant small business insurance in under 60 seconds. Raised $102M+ total including $50M Series B (2021) and $27M growth round (2024, Hiscox participated). Revenue grew 200%+ in 2023. Sub-60% loss ratio for 8 consecutive quarters. Operates in all 50 states via independent agents/brokers. Named Best Insurtech by Fintech Breakthrough Awards 2024. Founded 2018 in Cincinnati. 100% digital underwriting.

name: Coalition
tagline: Active cyber insurance with AI risk monitoring
summary: Coalition combines cyber insurance with active security monitoring and risk scanning. Valued at $5B after $250M Series F in 2022; raised $860M total from Ribbit, Index, Valor, and Allianz X. One of the largest cyber insurers in the US and Canada. Premium run rate was $325M in 2021 (800% YoY growth). Provides continuous risk assessment and threat intelligence to policyholders—not just coverage but prevention.

name: Hippo
summary: Hippo is a public insurtech (HIPO) offering home insurance with smart device integration. Hit $372M revenue in 2024 (+77% YoY) and first positive adjusted EBITDA quarter. Gross loss ratio improved ~30 points in 2024. Q4 2024 turned $44M net income vs. $42M loss prior year. Insurance-as-a-Service accounts for 81% of premiums. $571M in cash and investments. Targeting net income profitability by Q4 2025.

name: Bestow
summary: Bestow provides life insurance technology infrastructure for carriers. Tripled revenue in 2024 with 10x growth over two years. Raised $120M Series D in 2025 from Goldman Sachs and Smith Point Capital; $300M+ total equity funding. Pivoted in 2024: sold carrier/consumer business to Sammons Financial, now focused on B2B SaaS. 100% customer retention, 245% YoY transaction volume growth.

name: Marshmallow
tagline: AI pricing for immigrant auto insurance
summary: Marshmallow builds car insurance for UK immigrants who historically paid 51% above market rates. $500M revenue run rate, profitable, 1M+ drivers insured. Raised $90M in April 2025 from Portage, BlackRock, and Columbia Lake Partners at $2B+ valuation (up from $1.25B). Uses international driving records and telematics for underwriting. One of only two UK unicorns with Black founders. Founded by twin brothers Alexander and Oliver Kent-Braham.

name: Pibit.ai
summary: Pibit.AI builds CURE (Centralized Underwriting Risk Environment), an agentic AI platform for commercial underwriting. Raised $7M Series A (Nov 2025) led by Stellaris, Y Combinator, Arali. Customers include HDVI, Shepherd Insurance, Method Insurance reporting 85% faster underwriting cycles and 32% higher GWP per underwriter. Founded 2020 in SF by Akash Agarwal and Karan Bedi. Platform handles submissions, document parsing, risk analysis, and workflow orchestration.

name: Corgi Insurance
summary: Corgi is the first AI-native insurance carrier built for startups. Raised $108M Series A (Jan 2026) at $630M valuation from YC, Kindred Ventures, SV Angel, Contrary. $40M+ ARR with 40K+ customers across 49 states. Sub-1% churn. Founded 2024 (YC S24) by Nico Laqua and Emily Yuan in SF. Offers D&O, E&O, cyber, GL, HNOA, fiduciary, and AI liability coverage. Full carrier approval achieved July 2025.

name: Sixfold
summary: Sixfold uses generative AI to accelerate insurance underwriting. Raised $15M Series A led by Salesforce Ventures with Scale VP and Bessemer. Customers include AXIS Capital, Zurich Insurance Group, Generali, and Mosaic. Zurich launched in 4 offices Jan 2025. Won Zurich Innovation Championship 2024 (3,000+ applicants). Referral Agent drafts escalation emails in seconds vs. ~1 hour manually. Lloyd's Lab Cohort 12 participant.

name: Puzzle
summary: Puzzle is an AI-powered accounting platform rebuilt from scratch with a smarter general ledger. Raised $66.5M+ including $30M round led by S32 and XYZ Capital with General Catalyst, Felicis, Kapor. Automates up to 90% of routine accounting tasks. Integrates with Stripe, Gusto, Rippling, Mercury, Brex, Ramp, Pulley. Founded 2019 in SF by Sasha Orloff (prev. LendUp) and John Cwikla. 50+ CFO angel investors.

name: Pilot
summary: Pilot provides bookkeeping, tax, and CFO services for startups. Valued at $1.2B after $100M Series C led by Bezos Expeditions and Whale Rock Capital. Serves 1,700+ customers with ~$25K average revenue per customer. Raised $160-325M total from Sequoia, Index, and Bezos. Competes with Bench and Zeni in the tech-enabled bookkeeping space. Team of 250-340 employees combining software automation with human accountants.

name: Zeni
summary: Zeni is an AI-powered bookkeeping and finance concierge for VC-backed startups. Raised $47.5M total including $34M Series B. Saw 550% revenue growth and 375% customer growth YoY in early years. Processed $300M+ transactions first year; on track to $1B annually. Valued at $100-186M as of mid-2024. Pricing at $549-799/month. Combines AI automation with human finance experts (CPAs, controllers). Founded 2019 in Palo Alto by Snehal and Swapnil Shinde.

name: Taxfix
summary: Taxfix is Europe's leading digital tax filing platform. Unicorn at $1B+ valuation after $220M Series D led by Ontario Teachers. 6M+ tax returns submitted across Germany, UK, Spain. Recovered €4.5B+ for users. 5M+ app downloads. Doubled revenue Q1 2024 while expanding to Spain. 500+ employees in Berlin and Madrid. Costs €39.99 per submission or 20% of refund for expert service. Founded 2016 by Mathis Büchi and Lino Teuteberg.

name: Pennylane
summary: Pennylane provides accounting software for French SMBs and their accountants. Raised €175M (Jan 2026) at €3.6B valuation from Sequoia, CapitalG, and Meritech. Previously unicorn at €1B (2024). Serves 4,500 accounting firms and 350,000+ businesses. User base grew 40x in two years; 95% of enterprise customers come through accountant partnerships. Approaching profitability. Expanding across Europe.

name: Blue Dot
summary: Blue Dot (formerly VATBox) pioneered AI-driven VAT recovery and tax compliance for enterprises. Raised $82M+ including $32M round led by Ibex Investors. Customers include Amazon, BAT, Dell, and many Fortune 1000 companies. Exclusive Tax Assurance partner for SAP Concur. Offices in London, Paris, Munich, NYC, Tel Aviv. Partnered with KPMG Germany on taxable employee benefits. Founded 2013 in Tel Aviv.

name: TaxGPT
summary: TaxGPT is an AI tax copilot for accounting firms. Raised $4.6M (Feb 2025) from Rebel Fund, Y Combinator, and angels including Jason Calacanis. 10K+ CPAs, tax lawyers, and enrolled agents serving 250K clients use the platform. Uses GPT-4o and Claude 3.5. 10x productivity claims. Founded 2023 by Kashif Ali and Isabella Maceda-Ali. Addresses $260B annual tax complexity cost and 75% CPA retirement wave.

name: Uplinq
tagline: AI bookkeeping and tax for SMBs
summary: Uplinq provides AI-powered bookkeeping and tax solutions for SMBs. Raised $10M Series A (May 2025) led by Next Coast Ventures with Live Oak Ventures. Supports ~1,000 businesses across ecommerce, healthcare, logistics, hospitality. Customers report 80% reduction in manual data entry. 3x growth in 2024. Proprietary AI uses LLMs for instant business understanding. Also offers credit decisioning platform leveraging 10K+ data sources for lenders.

name: Compliance.ai (Archer)
summary: Compliance.ai provides ML-powered regulatory change management for financial services. Acquired by Archer (Feb 2024). Raised $13M total through Series B led by JAM FINTOP with Cota Capital before exit. 70+ mid-to-large regulated and multinational institution clients. Founded 2016 in SF by Danielle Deibler and Kayvan Alikhani. Platform monitors regulatory updates and maps changes to internal policies using patented EITL approach to ML.

name: FinregE
summary: FinregE provides AI-powered regulatory compliance software. Won prestigious FCA Handbook contract (May 2024-2029) to manage UK's definitive regulatory resource. Strategic investment from Moody's Corporation. Machine-readable regulatory data from 2,000+ global sources across 160+ countries. Built own LLM before ChatGPT, funded by Innovate UK Smart Grant with Imperial College London. Clients report 90% efficiency gains and $100K/month cost savings. Based in Canary Wharf, London.

name: Leo RegTech
tagline: AI compliance platform with Eva assistant
summary: Leo RegTech provides AI-powered compliance software with Eva, an AI assistant trained on UK regulations. Serves 100+ financial services firms including asset managers, PE, VC, hedge funds, brokers, and lawyers. Named to RegTech100 2025. Shortlisted in 3 categories for 2025 RegTech Insight Awards Europe. Platform covers compliance monitoring, employee declarations, personal account dealing, gifts tracking, and AML/Market Abuse training. Founded 2021 in London.

name: SAIFR (Fidelity)
summary: SAIFR is a Fidelity Labs incubated RegTech for marketing and content compliance in financial services. AI flags 90% of what humans would, enabling 10x faster time to market. Launched 2022; acquired GOST (adverse media screening) Feb 2024. Launched SaifrScreen for KYC/AML in May 2024. Won A-Team Innovation Award 2024 and AIFintech100 two years running. Products: SaifrReview, SaifrScan, SaifrScreen, APIs.

name: Ascent RegTech
summary: Ascent RegTech (now AscentAI) provides AI-powered regulatory intelligence that automates compliance obligations mapping. Acquired by Edgewater Capital in Jan 2024, then acquired Waymark and rebranded. Platform ingests 2,000+ regulatory sources and maps them to specific policies/controls. Customers include banks, broker-dealers, and asset managers. Series B with $30M raised. Founded 2015 in Chicago. Reduces manual regulatory analysis from weeks to hours.

name: Ayasdi
tagline: ML for risk and AML compliance
summary: Ayasdi (now SymphonyAI Sensa) provides ML-powered AML and financial crime detection. Acquired by SymphonyAI in 2019. HSBC reduced false positives by 20%+ using Ayasdi AML. SymphonyAI won Microsoft Partner of the Year for AI Innovation, RegTech of the Year 2024, and Chartis GenAI Initiatives Award. Customers achieve up to 81x risk-to-alert improvement and 77% reduction in false positives. Founded 2008. Products include SensaAI for AML and Sanctions.

name: Revolut
summary: Revolut is Europe's most valuable private fintech, a super-app offering banking, payments, crypto, and investing. Hit $4B revenue in 2024 (+72% YoY) with $1.4B profit before tax and $1B net profit. 65M+ customers globally (2025). Valued at $75B (Nov 2025) in round led by Coatue, with a16z, NVIDIA, Fidelity, T. Rowe Price. UK's largest neobank with 10M+ users. Revolut Business hit $1B annualized revenue. Fourth consecutive profitable year.

name: Nubank
summary: Nubank is the world's largest neobank by revenue and LatAm's biggest digital bank. Public company (NU) with $11.5B revenue in 2024 (+58% YoY) and $2.2B adjusted net income (nearly doubled YoY). Serves 114M+ customers across Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia. Brazil's 3rd-largest financial institution by customer count. $78B+ market cap. 32% annualized adjusted ROE. 10M+ customers in Mexico, 2.5M in Colombia.

name: Monzo
summary: Monzo is one of the UK's leading neobanks with 12.2M users and £16.6B in deposits. Hit £1.2B revenue in FY2025 (+48% YoY) with £113.9M pre-tax profit (8x increase). Second consecutive profitable year. Loan portfolio £2.2B (+35%). 1M+ customers on subscription plans. Business banking at 400K+ customers. Valued at $5.9B (Oct 2024). Strong budgeting tools and instant spending notifications. Expanding lending products and US market.

name: Kasisto
summary: Kasisto builds KAI, a banking-specific conversational AI platform and the first finance-focused LLM (KAI-GPT). Customers include J.P. Morgan, Westpac, Standard Chartered, TD Bank, and Mastercard. Raised $90M+ total including $18.5M Series B+ from FIS Strategic Investments and Westpac. Platform handles millions of banking interactions monthly with 90%+ containment. SRI International spinoff founded 2013 in NYC.

name: MX
summary: MX is a leading open finance data platform competing with Plaid. Valued at $1.9B with $610M raised including $300M Series C led by TPG. Powers 300K+ data sharing connections across 16K+ financial institutions. Customers include 85+ of top 100 US digital banking providers. AI-driven transaction cleansing and categorization with 98%+ accuracy. Founded 2010 in Lehi, Utah. 800+ employees.

name: Virtuals Protocol (VIRTUAL)
tagline: AI agent creation and tokenization platform on Base
summary: Virtuals Protocol is the leading AI agent tokenization platform on Base, enabling creation and co-ownership of AI agents. Hosts 2,200+ agents including viral hits like Luna and AIXBT. Generated $8B+ DEX trading volume across agent tokens. Reached $5B+ market cap at peak in Jan 2025. VIRTUAL token provides governance and revenue sharing. Singapore-based team. First protocol to enable tokenized AI agent economies at scale.

name: AIXBT
tagline: AI market analysis agent on Virtuals
summary: AIXBT is an AI agent on Virtuals Protocol providing crypto market sentiment analysis. Monitors 400+ KOLs to surface alpha via the AIXBT Terminal. Launched Nov 2024 on Base; hit $800M market cap and $0.95 ATH in Jan 2025. Requires 600K tokens (~$200K) for terminal access. Price rose from $0.00032 to $0.20 in first month. Now trading around $0.15-0.17 with $150M+ market cap.

name: VaderAI
summary: VaderAI is an AI agent on Virtuals Protocol that autonomously trades AI agent tokens, aiming to be 'BlackRock of the AI agent world.' Launched December 2024 on Base. 1B token supply. Hit $0.1585 ATH in Jan 2025 from $0.00057 at launch. Part of the 2024 AI agent crypto explosion where sector grew from $4.8B to $15.5B market cap in Q4. Users participate in AI-managed DAOs for crypto portfolio trading.

name: Spectral (SPEC)
tagline: No-code AI agents for DeFi automation
summary: Spectral Labs enables no-code AI agents for DeFi automation. Raised $30M total including $23M led by Social Capital and General Catalyst with Samsung, Circle, Jump Capital, Franklin Templeton. Spectral Syntax translates natural language to Solidity code. Users can automate tasks like 'Buy ETH when price drops 5%' without coding. IEO on Gate.io May 2024. InferChain mainnet expected early 2025.

name: Bittensor (TAO)
tagline: Decentralized AI network with subnet economy
summary: Bittensor is a decentralized AI network where ML models train collaboratively for TAO rewards. 120+ active subnets with combined $850M+ market cap. No VC funding, pre-mine, or team allocation—fair launch. 70% of TAO staked. First halving Dec 2025. DCG holds 500K+ TAO (~$175-200M); Polychain ~$200M. Grayscale filed for NYSE-listed ETF (GTAO). Founded by ex-Google engineer Jacob Steeves. 100K+ wallet accounts.

name: Targon Compute (SN4)
summary: Targon is Bittensor Subnet 4, a decentralized AI inference platform. Raised $10.5M Series A (Aug 2025) led by OSS Capital with angels Ram Shriram (early Google) and Shopify's Tobias Lütke. Aggregates $70M+ NVIDIA hardware (H200s, L40s) with trusted execution for privacy. ~$100K/month revenue from Character AI-type apps. Launched Secure Targon Compute Oct 2025. Built by Manifold Labs in Austin; founded by Robert Myers (ex-Opentensor).

name: Hippius
summary: Hippius (Subnet 75) is the first Bittensor subnet token listed on a CEX (MEXC Oct 2025). Provides decentralized cloud storage for Bittensor's AI network—the 'missing piece' for persistent memory. Built on custom Substrate blockchain bridged to Bittensor. Launched March 2025. Received 50K USDT incentive from MEXC. Barry Silbert acknowledged as key Bittensor contributor.

name: Yuma
summary: Yuma is a DCG subsidiary and Bittensor subnet accelerator led by Barry Silbert (CEO). Launched Nov 2024 with 25 employees. Third-largest validator on Bittensor. Partners: Sturdy, Masa, Score, Infinite Games. Launched S&P 500 Oracle subnet with Foundry. Onboarded 8 institutional validators (BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com). Yuma Asset Management anchored with $10M from DCG. DCG invested in Bittensor since 2021.

name: ElizaOS
summary: ElizaOS is a decentralized DAO on Solana managed by an AI agent named 'Marc AIndreessen.' Founded by Shaw Walters in October 2024, it grew to $2.5B market cap within months. Rebranded to ElizaOS in January 2025 after a16z requested the name change. The ElizaOS framework enables autonomous AI agents with multi-platform support (Discord, Twitter, DEXs) and is now used across dozens of crypto projects.

name: Fetch.ai (FET)
summary: Fetch.ai leads the Artificial Superintelligence Alliance (ASI), formed in March 2024 by merging with SingularityNET and Ocean Protocol into a combined $7.5B entity. CEO Humayun Sheikh serves as ASI Chairman. The FET token became ASI in July 2024. Built infrastructure for autonomous economic agents that can transact, negotiate, and coordinate without human intervention. Based in Cambridge, UK.

name: SingularityNET (AGIX/FET)
summary: SingularityNET operates a decentralized marketplace for AI services, allowing developers to publish and monetize AI algorithms. Founded by Dr. Ben Goertzel in 2017; he now serves as CEO of the ASI Alliance. AGIX tokens merged into ASI in July 2024 as part of the Artificial Superintelligence Alliance with Fetch.ai and Ocean Protocol. Known for developing Sophia the robot with Hanson Robotics.

name: Ocean Protocol (OCEAN/FET)
summary: Ocean Protocol provides a decentralized data marketplace enabling data owners to monetize their data while preserving privacy through compute-to-data. Joined the ASI Alliance in 2024 but announced withdrawal in October 2025, citing alignment concerns. ~81% of OCEAN supply converted to FET/ASI. Enables AI model training on private datasets without exposing raw data. Founded 2017 in Singapore.

name: Render (RENDER)
summary: Render Network connects GPU owners with creators needing rendering power, offering decentralized compute for 3D graphics and AI workloads. Founded by OTOY CEO Jules Urbach; first conceived 2009, launched 2020. Integrated with Apple through OctaneX app for iPad and Vision Pro. Supports OctaneRender, Redshift, Blender Cycles, plus generative AI tools from Runway and Stability AI. RENDER gained 1,000%+ in 2023, peaked at $13.53 in March 2024.

name: Autonolas (OLAS)
summary: Autonolas (Olas) is a pioneer in crypto AI agents since 2021. Raised $13.8M led by 1kx (Feb 2025) to launch Pearl, an agent app store. 700K+ agent transactions per month (30%+ MoM growth), 3.5M+ total transactions across 9 chains. Open Autonomy framework enables building any off-chain service. Olas Accelerator offers up to $1M in grants. Built by Valory AG in London. Developed by team behind Gnosis Safe.

name: ChainGPT
summary: ChainGPT offers AI tools for blockchain including smart contract auditing, NFT generation, and market analysis. Launched $1M Web3 AI Grant Program. ChainGPT Pad launched 50+ projects (Solidus AI Tech, GT Protocol, Openfabric, DexCheck, Nuklai). $106M+ market cap (May 2024). Rolled out API/SDK in Feb 2024. CryptoGuard security extension launched June 2024. Partnerships with Chainlink, TronDAO, BNB Chain. #1 DappBay Top User Growth Oct 2024.

name: PAAL AI
summary: PAAL AI offers crypto AI tools: MyPAAL (personalized assistant), AutoPAAL (market analysis), AutoPAAL-X (trading bot), and PaalX (in-chat DEX). Released PaaLLM-0.5 Web3 language model with 1M token context and live crypto data. PaalX exchange hit $50M+ volume. 7x price gain Jan-Mar 2024, peaked at $0.86. ~$45M market cap. 897M tokens circulating of 1B max supply.

name: ARC (AI Rig Complex)
summary: AI Rig Complex (ARC) is an open-source Rust framework for building AI agents on Solana. Launched Dec 2024 by Playgrounds Analytics. Supports DeepSeek, Gemini, OpenAI, Perplexity, Anthropic models. Offers grants for devs building Rust agents for DeFi. $74M+ market cap, 1B token supply. Hit $0.63 ATH Jan 2025. Extended to Polygon Feb 2025. Token used for agent calls, compute contribution rewards, and governance voting.

name: OpenAI
summary: OpenAI builds GPT models powering ChatGPT, used by 800M+ weekly users and 92% of Fortune 500 companies. Hit $12B+ ARR by mid-2025, targeting $20B by year-end. Raised $17.9B total including $14B from Microsoft and $30B from SoftBank; valued at $300-500B. ChatGPT Plus has 15M+ subscribers. Lost $5B in 2024 on $3.7B revenue. Expects profitability by 2029; IPO potentially 2026.

name: Anthropic
summary: Anthropic builds Claude, widely used in finance for research, compliance, and coding. Valued at $350B after $5B from Microsoft and $10B from NVIDIA (Nov 2025); $10B round led by Coatue/GIC (Jan 2026). ARR surpassed $9B by end of 2025 (from $1B in early 2025). Amazon invested $8B total; Google invested $3B. Claude Code generates $500M+ run rate. Founded 2021 by ex-OpenAI researchers including Dario Amodei. IPO expected 2026.

name: Google DeepMind
summary: Google DeepMind develops Gemini models (2.0 through 3 Pro) used across Google products including finance. Gemini powers Google Finance's Deep Search for comprehensive market analysis, integrating prediction market data from Kalshi and Polymarket. AlphaFold revolutionized protein structure prediction. Part of Alphabet ($2T+ market cap); GOOGL up 63% in 2025 driven by AI monetization. Demis Hassabis leads from London HQ.

name: Bloomberg AI
summary: Bloomberg Terminal generates 85%+ of Bloomberg's $12B+ annual revenue (~$24K/user/year). Integrated BloombergGPT, a 50B parameter finance-specific LLM trained on 700B+ tokens including proprietary data. AI powers earnings summaries, search, and analyst workflows. 400 Bloomberg Intelligence analysts helped train the models. Early AI beta users include Schroders, Bernstein, and Mizuho Securities.

name: Refinitiv (LSEG)
summary: Refinitiv (now LSEG Data & Analytics) serves 40,000+ customers and 400,000+ users across 190 markets with financial data, market feeds, and AI-powered analytics. Acquired by London Stock Exchange Group in 2021. Revenue contributes to LSEG's £8.6B+ total. Strategic AI partnership with Microsoft to build next-gen financial infrastructure. Rebranded from Refinitiv in August 2023.

name: Affirm
summary: Affirm is the largest US BNPL company by revenue, claiming 50%+ of the US pay-later market. Public company (AFRM) with $2.3B revenue in 2024 (+46% YoY) and $28B GMV. 21M active users and 323K merchants. Founded by PayPal co-founder Max Levchin. Profitable in recent quarters. Average transactions per user reached 4.9 in Q4 2024 (up from 10% quarterly frequency in FY21 to 40% in FY24).

name: Klarna
summary: Klarna is Europe's leading BNPL provider, now going public on NYSE (KLAR) at ~$14B valuation after raising $1.25B. Hit $2.8B revenue in 2024 (+24% YoY) with first full-year profit since 2019 ($21M net). 111M users, 790K merchants, $105B GMV. AI automated customer service saving $40M/year; workforce cut from 5K to 3.5K. Valuation fell from $45.6B peak (2021) to $6.7B (2022) before recovery.

name: Harvey
tagline: AI for legal and financial document analysis
summary: Harvey builds AI for law firms and legal teams. Valued at $8B after $160M Series F led by a16z (Dec 2025). Raised $760M in 2025 alone (Series D $300M at $3B, Series E $300M at $5B, Series F $160M at $8B). Surpassed $100M ARR in Aug 2025. 50 of top AmLaw 100 firms as customers. Co-founded 2022 by Winston Weinberg (ex-O'Melveny) and Gabriel Pereyra (ex-DeepMind/Meta). Early adopter Allen & Overy was first magic circle firm to deploy.

name: Hebbia
summary: Hebbia builds AI document analysis for finance and legal teams. Raised $130M Series B at $700M valuation from a16z, Index, GV, and Peter Thiel. Hit $13M ARR in 2024 (15x growth in 18 months). Claims 33% of top global asset managers as customers including Centerview, Charlesbank, and Oak Hill. Matrix product runs multi-step reasoning across unlimited documents. Expanding into law, pharma, and government (US Air Force).

name: Auquan
tagline: AI agents for financial research workflows
summary: Auquan automates deep research workflows for asset managers using RAG-powered AI agents. Tripled revenue in 2024; raised $8M seed led by Peak XV. Customers include MetLife, UBS, Capital Group, and 25% of top 20 global asset managers. Generates 30-page credit memos in 5 minutes vs. 5 days manually. Covers 550K+ companies across 2M+ sources in 65+ languages. Selected for Microsoft UK GenAI Accelerator.

name: Fira
summary: Fira is an agentic AI analyst for financial research, starting with UK investment firms. YC-backed (W25), raised $500K seed. Uses Quartr API for earnings data. Reads complex tables, scanned docs with cell-level citations. Targets investment banks, M&A advisors, hedge funds. Founded 2024 in SF by Alex Tkachenko (ex-Hashscan) and Alexey Taktarov (ex-resume.io CTO, sold 2021).

name: Aumni (JPMorgan)
summary: Aumni provides investment analytics software for venture capital, acquired by JPMorgan in April 2023 for ~$232M. Serves 300+ institutional investors managing 17K+ companies and $600B+ invested capital. Integrates with JPM's Capital Connect platform. 350+ employees in Salt Lake City and Philippines. Analytics engine structures legal/economic terms of private market transactions. JPMorgan led 2021 investment round before acquisition. Founded 2018.

name: Highradius
summary: HighRadius provides AI-powered order-to-cash and treasury automation. Valued at $3.1B after $300M Series C from Tiger Global and D1 Capital. Serves 600+ customers including 200+ Fortune 1000 and Forbes Global 2000 companies. Processes $2.23T+ in annual receivables. 2024 Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader (3rd year). Forbes Cloud 100 (5th consecutive year). 1,000-5,000 employees. Acquired Cforia in Feb 2024.

name: Kyriba
summary: Kyriba provides cloud-based treasury and cash management serving 3,400+ clients in 170 countries, connected to 9,900+ banks. Processed 3B transactions worth $15T in 2024. Valued at $3B after General Atlantic-led Series E in October 2024. Euromoney's Best Treasury Management System 2025. 98%+ client retention. Customers include Amway, EA, Qualcomm, and PulteGroup. 1,000 employees based in San Diego.

name: Trovata
summary: Trovata automates cash management using APIs connecting to 2,000+ banks globally. Manages $100B+ in cash for hundreds of mid-market and enterprise customers including Block, Etsy, DraftKings, and Krispy Kreme. Raised $65.8M backed by JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, and Capital One. First to launch generative AI for treasury (2023). Named fastest-growing treasury platform in US. Founded 2016 in San Diego.

name: Tesorio
summary: Tesorio is an AI-powered cash flow and AR automation platform. Raised $17M Series B led by BAMCAP Ventures. Orchestrated $80B+ in receivables. Customers include Box, Veeva, Slack, WP Engine, Instructure. Slack scaled to thousands of customers with just 2 collections staff using Tesorio. 33-day DSO reductions, 3x collections productivity reported. Founded 2013 in SF by Carlos Vega and Fabio Fleitas.

name: Campfire
summary: Campfire is an AI-native ERP replacing NetSuite for startups. Raised $100M+ total: $65M Series B (Oct 2025, Accel/Ribbit), $35M Series A (June 2025, Accel). 10x YTD revenue growth. Ember AI (Claude-powered) + L.A.M. (Large Accounting Model) achieves 95% reconciliation accuracy. Customers: Replit, PostHog, Decagon, Carbon Direct. 40 employees. Founded 2023, YC-backed.

name: Xelix
summary: Xelix is an AI-powered Accounts Payable audit and fraud prevention platform. Raised $160M Series B (July 2025) led by Insight Partners with Passion Capital and LocalGlobe. Processes 115M+ invoices annually, audits $750B+ spend for 130+ customers including AstraZeneca, GSK, BAT, Virgin Atlantic. AI reviews 500+ data points per invoice. Pioneer in AP controls since 2018. London-based.

name: Borderless/Alberni
tagline: AI agent for global employment automation
summary: Borderless AI builds Alberni, the first AI agent for global HR. Raised $27M seed (Mar 2024) led by Susquehanna and Aglaé (Bernard Arnault). Operates in 170 languages, handles contracts, legal analysis, tax queries. Exclusive Cohere LLM partner for HR. $579/employee/month. Customers include Raya, MG2, Affiniti, PayBright. EOR market: $5B+ (2023), growing $1B/year. Founded 2022 in Toronto by Willson Cross.

name: Niural
tagline: EMMA AI agent runs payroll across 150 countries
summary: Niural is an AI-native global PEO running payroll in 150+ countries via EMMA SuperAgent. Raised $31M Series A led by Marathon Management with M13 and Inspired Capital. 700% ARR growth, 180%+ NRR. Customers include Polygon Labs, Tensor, Slingshot AI. Saves 60 hours/month, cuts HR/FX costs 50%, reduces payroll errors 90%. Global payroll market expected to hit $133B by 2027.

name: Cleo
tagline: AI financial assistant for Gen Z
summary: Cleo is an AI financial assistant targeting Gen Z users living paycheck-to-paycheck. Hit $136M revenue in 2024 (doubled YoY) with 8.4% EBITDA margin and profitability from Aug onwards. 5M+ users, 74M conversations in 2024 (2.5x YoY). Raised $175M total at $500M valuation. Revenue nearly 100% from US. Monetizes via subscriptions unlocking credit-builder card and cash advances. CEO teasing IPO.

name: Albert
summary: Albert offers AI-powered financial guidance with automatic savings, spending insights, and cash advances (Albert Instant) to avoid overdrafts. Raised $172M including $100M Series C led by General Atlantic with CapitalG (Alphabet's growth fund) and QED. Named to 2024 Exceptional Startups list (100%+ YoY growth required). Founded 2015 in Los Angeles by Yinon Ravid and Andrzej Baraniak.

name: Copilot Money
summary: Copilot Money is a premium AI-powered budgeting app that boomed after Mint shut down. 100K+ subscribers, many using it daily. Raised $10.5M total including $6M Series A led by Adjacent. Profitable since 2023. Apple Design Award Finalist 2024. 20% 'heavy users' (5-10x/day). Ad-free, privacy-first. Founded 2020 by ex-Google engineer. Investors include Scott Belsky (Adobe CPO), Immad Akhund (Mercury). 15 employees.

name: Earnest Analytics (Consumer Edge)
summary: Earnest Analytics (formerly Earnest Research) provides consumer and healthcare transaction data for investors. Acquired by Consumer Edge (April 2025). Raised $33.5M total including $15M Series B led by Pivot Investment Partners with Greycroft, Osage, Bonfire Ventures. Products include Orion Consumer Spend and Leo Medical Claims. Founded 2012 in NYC. Comprehensive alternative data measuring consumer/healthcare economies.

name: Thinknum
summary: Thinknum provides alternative data by scraping and structuring web data for investors. Raised $12.6M total through Series A led by Green Visor Capital with 500 Global, Pear VC, 645 Ventures. Customers include Barclays, Goldman Sachs, and Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Tracks job postings, pricing, reviews, and other web signals. Alternative data market projected to hit $79B by 2029 at 52.6% CAGR. Founded 2015 in NYC.

name: Yipitdata
summary: YipitData provides alternative data analytics for investors, tracking consumer transactions, app usage, and web data. Hit $101M revenue in 2024 at $1B valuation. Serves 150+ hedge funds and 4,000+ investors. Raised $497M including $475M Series E led by Carlyle in 2021. 725 employees across US, APAC, and India. Acquired Edison Software in 2021 for email receipt data. Tracks 70+ companies with <2% variance from reported metrics.

name: Quandl (Nasdaq)
summary: Quandl was acquired by Nasdaq in December 2018. Now operates as Nasdaq Data Link. Had raised $17.4M including $12M Series B from August Capital, Nexus VP, and iGan Partners. Served 30K+ monthly active users including 8 of top 10 hedge funds and 14 of top 15 banks. Provides alternative and core financial data from 350+ sources. Founded 2012 in Toronto. Team offers free data alongside premium institutional datasets.

name: Ribbon Home
summary: Ribbon Home provided cash-backed offers to help homebuyers compete with cash buyers. Raised $625M total including $330M in 2019 from Greylock, Bain Capital, and NFX. Shut down in November 2022 after laying off 170 employees amid the housing market downturn. Key assets acquired by Hurst Lending, which relaunched RibbonHome.com with similar alternative home financing products.

name: CAPE Analytics
summary: CAPE Analytics uses deep learning and geospatial imagery to provide instant property intelligence for insurers. Acquired by Moody's in Q1 2025. $61M raised, serving 50+ subscription customers including The Hartford, State Farm, Mercury Insurance, and Hippo. Covers 70M+ US single-family homes plus commercial properties. Founded 2014, backed by insurance strategic investors.

name: Citadel Securities
summary: Citadel Securities is the dominant US market maker, posting $9.7B net trading revenue in 2024 (+55% YoY) and $4.2B net income (doubled YoY). 23% market share in cash equities, 40% in retail order flow. Processes ~1/3 of all US retail stock trades. $5.2B EBITDA, $16B net trading capital. Revenue exceeds Deutsche Bank and Barclays trading desks. Led by CEO Peng Zhao under Ken Griffin's Citadel umbrella.

name: Two Sigma
summary: Two Sigma is a leading quant hedge fund using AI, ML, and distributed computing. Manages $110B+ in client assets. Co-founders Overdeck and Siegel stepped down as co-CEOs in Aug 2024 after relationship collapsed. 2024 saw SEC investigation after unauthorized model changes; firm repaid client losses. Comparable returns to D.E. Shaw and Renaissance. Strong 2024 performance among top quant funds.

name: D.E. Shaw
summary: D.E. Shaw is a top quant hedge fund managing $120B+ in assets. Topped 2024 LCH rankings with $11.1B in investor gains. Flagship Composite fund returned 18%; Oculus macro fund hit 36% (best year ever). #2 all-time in net gains ($67.2B). Returning billions to investors after strong 2024; Composite and Oculus closed to new capital. Founded 1988 by David Shaw, who now focuses on computational biochemistry.

name: Renaissance Technologies
summary: Renaissance Technologies runs the legendary Medallion Fund—66% gross / 39% net annualized returns since 1988, generating $100B+ in trading gains. Medallion ($10-15B AUM) returned 30% in 2024; closed to outsiders since 1993. Institutional funds RIEF and RIDA returned 22.7% and 15.6% in 2024. Total AUM ~$89B. Founder Jim Simons died May 2024 at 86. Best-performing hedge fund in history.

name: Jane Street
summary: Jane Street is a quantitative trading firm that posted $20.5B net trading revenue in 2024 (nearly doubled YoY) and $13B net income—exceeding Citi and BofA trading desks. 10%+ of US equity market, 24% primary / 16% secondary US ETF market share. $707B monthly ETF trading volume. 8% of OCC options volume. Dwarfs competitors: Optiver ($3.8B), Virtu ($2.9B), Flow Traders ($530M).

name: Bridgewater
summary: Bridgewater Associates is the world's largest hedge fund by AUM ($124-136B). Flagship Pure Alpha returned 11.3% in 2024. All Weather Plus China fund hit 35%. Ray Dalio stepped back 2020, retired 2022. Divided into two units in 2024: Alpha Engine (Pure Alpha) and Total Portfolio Strategies (All Weather). Cut 7% of workforce (90 employees) in 2024. China AUM doubled to $5.5B in early 2024.

name: WorldQuant
summary: WorldQuant is a quantitative asset manager spun out of Millennium Management in 2007, now managing $20B+ as Millennium's primary quant partner. 1,000+ employees across 27 global offices. Built a library of 4 million 'alphas' (predictive trading signals) through its WebSim crowdsourced research platform. Processes thousands of alternative data sources annually using ML and statistical arbitrage.

name: High-Flyer
summary: High-Flyer (幻方量化) is a leading Chinese quant fund that peaked at 100B yuan (~$14B) AUM before pivoting resources to AI research. Founded DeepSeek, the AI lab behind the DeepSeek-R1 model. Serves 10,000+ HNW individuals and institutions, winning China's Golden Bull Award multiple times. Second-best performing Chinese quant fund in 2025 with 56.6% returns. Consistently beat CSI 300 from 2018-2024.

name: Ubiquity (China)
summary: Ubiquant (九坤投资) is a leading Chinese quantitative hedge fund based in Beijing. One of China's top quant firms using machine learning for systematic trading strategies. Competes with High-Flyer and other domestic quant funds in China's growing algorithmic trading market. Known for talent recruitment from top global quant firms and universities.

name: Onfido (Entrust)
summary: Onfido was a leading AI identity verification provider acquired by Entrust for $650M (April 2024). Had $140M+ ARR and 1,200+ customers including Revolut and Orange before acquisition. Oxford University spinout (largest-ever return for student-led startup). Blocked $6B in fraud over 17 months; saw 3,000% increase in deepfakes. Now integrated into Entrust's identity-centric security suite.

name: Jumio
summary: Jumio is an AI-powered identity verification platform processing 1M+ verifications daily, with 1B+ total verifications to date. $196M raised from Andreessen Horowitz, Citi, and Great Hill Partners. ~$100M ARR serving 1,000+ enterprise customers including HSBC, Coinbase, Airbnb, and United Airlines. Founded 2010, backed early by Facebook co-founder Eduardo Saverin. 2024 Globee Cybersecurity Award winner.

name: Persona
summary: Persona provides identity verification infrastructure serving 3,000+ customers including OpenAI, LinkedIn, Instacart, and Block. Raised $200M Series D in 2025 at $2B valuation from Founders Fund and Ribbit. Hit $141M revenue in 2024 (doubled YoY) with 300M+ verifications processed. Ranked #1 in 2024 Gartner Critical Capabilities and highest for Execution in inaugural Magic Quadrant for Identity Verification.

name: Veriff
summary: Veriff is an Estonian identity verification provider serving 2,000+ businesses. Hit $42M revenue in 2024 with 75% QoQ growth in Q4; customers up 60% YoY. Raised $192M at $1.5B valuation from Accel, Tiger, and Y Combinator. Customers include Bolt, Blockchain, Trustpilot, and UK banks like Crown Agents and Griffin. Strong LatAm growth (2.5x volumes). Achieved iBeta Level 2 biometric liveness certification.

name: Sumsub
summary: Sumsub is a full-stack identity verification and onboarding platform. Hit $86M revenue in 2024 (doubled YoY). Serves 2,000+ clients across 220 countries including crypto exchanges and fintechs. Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader for Identity Verification 2024. Industry-leading conversion rates: 91.6% US, 95.9% UK, sub-50-second average verification. 615 employees with offices in Miami, Singapore, Dubai.

name: Kensho (S&P Global)
summary: Kensho is S&P Global's AI division, acquired for $550M in 2018—one of the largest AI acquisitions in financial services at the time. Founded 2013 at Harvard, raised $67.5M pre-acquisition. Powers S&P's analytics with NLP, transcription, and data enrichment. Launched Kensho LLM-ready API in 2024 enabling natural language queries against Capital IQ and Compustat datasets.

name: DataRobot
summary: DataRobot provides an automated ML platform for enterprise AI. Hit $285M revenue in 2024 with 850 customers. Raised $1B+ at $6.3B valuation in 2021 from Tiger Global, Altimeter, and Salesforce Ventures. 90%+ revenue from recurring subscriptions. Founded by data scientists from Travelers insurance. Acquired 10 companies including Agnostiq. Launched Agent Workforce Platform in 2025.

name: H2O.ai
summary: H2O.ai provides open-source and enterprise ML/AI platform serving 20,000+ organizations. Hit $75M revenue in 2024. Valued at $1.7B after $100M Series E led by Commonwealth Bank of Australia. Customers include AT&T, Capital One, PayPal, P&G, and over half of Fortune 500. Goldman Sachs, NVIDIA, and Wells Fargo are investors. NPS of 78, highest in industry. CRN AI 100 2024.

name: C3.ai
summary: C3.ai is a public enterprise AI platform (NYSE: AI) founded by Tom Siebel. Hit $311M revenue in FY2024 (+16% YoY) with accelerating growth. 71 deals in Q1 FY25 (up from 32 YoY), 52 pilot projects vs 24 prior year. Partners with Microsoft, Amazon, and McKinsey QuantumBlack. Stock down 72% since 2020 IPO. $724M cash, no debt. Reportedly weighing potential sale; Siebel stepping aside.

name: Palantir
summary: Palantir is a public data platform company (PLTR) whose stock soared 340% in 2024. Hit $2.87B revenue (+29% YoY) and $462M earnings (doubled). US commercial revenue grew 64% YoY; US government +45%. Top 20 customers average $64.6M annually. Joined S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 in 2024. 66% of revenue from US. Benefiting from enterprise AI adoption with Foundry and AIP platforms.

name: Snowflake
summary: Snowflake is a public cloud data platform (SNOW) that hit $3.63B revenue in FY2025 (+29% YoY) and $2.8B in FY2024 (+36%). 9,400+ customers including 580 with $1M+ annual spend and 745 Forbes Global 2000 companies. 126% net revenue retention. $5.2B remaining performance obligations. Expanding into AI with Cortex features and Snowpark for data engineering and ML workloads.

name: Databricks
summary: Databricks is the dominant unified data + AI platform, valued at $134B after $4B Series L (Dec 2025). Hit $4.8B revenue run-rate growing 55%+ YoY. 20,000+ customers including Mastercard, AT&T, and 60%+ of Fortune 500; 700+ customers above $1M ARR. Databricks SQL hit $600M run-rate (+150% YoY). Free cash flow positive with 140%+ net retention. IPO possible 2026.

name: Gauntlet
summary: Gauntlet is the leading DeFi risk management firm, securing protocols with $42B+ TVL including Aave, Compound, Maker, and Synthetix. Raised $23.8M Series B from Ribbit and Polychain at $1B valuation. Top clients pay $5M+ annually; Compound contract ~$1.45M/year. Founded 2018. Simulation-based risk models helped clients avoid major losses during Black Thursday 2020 and 2022 crypto crash.

name: Chaos Labs
summary: Chaos Labs provides on-chain risk management for 20+ DeFi protocols including Aave, GMX, Jupiter, and dYdX. Raised $55M Series A (2024) from Haun Ventures, Galaxy, PayPal Ventures; $20M seed from Galaxy with angels like Balaji and Naval. Secured $860B cumulative trading volume and $25B in loans. Tripled customer base in past year. Founded 2021.

name: Risk Harbor
summary: Risk Harbor is a parametric DeFi insurance protocol with automated claim payouts. Raised $3.25M seed co-led by Framework and Pantera with Bain Capital Ventures, Coinbase Ventures, and DCG. 20+ cover products for yield token and stablecoin risks. Paid $2.5M+ to UST depeg victims when it broke peg. 5+ underwriting pools on Arbitrum, Avalanche, Ethereum, Optimism. Pre-programmed triggers vs. governance votes for claims.

name: Goldfinch
tagline: AI credit scoring for emerging markets
summary: Goldfinch is a decentralized credit protocol for real-world lending, primarily in emerging markets. Raised $36.7M including $25M Series A from a16z crypto (2022). Issued $170M+ in loans across 28 countries. Goldfinch Prime offers exposure to institutional credit funds from Ares and Apollo targeting 9-12% returns. Backed by Coinbase Ventures, Bill Ackman.

name: Arturo
summary: Arturo is an AI property intelligence spin-out from American Family Insurance. Raised $46.7M through Series B from Atlantic Bridge, Crosslink, and IAG Firemark. Serves 2 of top 5 US P&C insurers plus leading Australian insurers (USAA, AmFam, IAG). Properties flagged for poor roof conditions saw 43% more Hurricane Ida damage. Launched change detection in 2024.

name: Tractable
summary: Tractable is an AI unicorn ($1B+ valuation) using computer vision for auto and property damage appraisal. Raised $65M Series E from SoftBank Vision Fund 2 (2023), $119M+ total. Processes $7B in claims annually for insurers including Geico, Aviva, Admiral, Tokio Marine, and Covéa. Claims up to 10x faster resolution. Founded 2014 in London.

name: Snapsheet
summary: Snapsheet is a claims management platform serving 170+ customers including 15 of top 20 US P&C carriers. Raised $162M with strategic backing from State Farm Ventures. Manages 4.3M+ claims annually processing $15.3B in indemnity. Achieved profitability and 13% YoY growth in 2023. Launched Snapsheet Total for total loss vehicles in 2024. Founded 2011.

name: CCC Intelligent
summary: CCC Intelligent Solutions (NASDAQ: CCCS) is the dominant auto claims platform connecting 35,000+ businesses. $945M revenue in 2024 (+9% YoY), $397M adjusted EBITDA (42% margin). 30,500+ repair facilities on CCC ONE network with 10,000+ using AI in production. Acquired EvolutionIQ to expand into disability and workers' comp. $5.7B market cap.

name: Personetics
summary: Personetics is the leading AI personalization platform for banks, serving 150M+ active monthly users with 1.2B monthly insights. Raised $85M in growth funding. Powers 130+ financial institutions including 18 of top 40 North American banks. Platform increases customer engagement by 35% and account growth by 20%. 4.6/5 customer rating. Founded 2011.

name: Posh Technologies
summary: Posh AI provides conversational AI for banks and credit unions. Raised $45M+ total including Series A led by Canapi Ventures with Curql Fund CUs. 100+ deployments with 200+ live products. Clients include Interra CU, Ion Bank, One Nevada CU, Southern Bank. ACU of Texas 'Ava' assistant handles 51%+ calls, 60%+ chats, 93% drop in call abandons. Boston-based. Dave Tucker (former CU exec) joined board 2024.

name: Glia
summary: Glia provides a unified digital customer service platform for financial institutions, combining messaging, video, voice, and AI-powered virtual assistants. Serves 500+ banks and credit unions including four of the top ten US banks. Reached unicorn status with over $152M raised from Insight Partners and Wildcat Capital. Launched Glia Cortex in 2024, an AI engine that handles entire customer interactions autonomously while seamlessly escalating to human agents when needed.

name: Finn AI (Glia)
summary: Finn AI was a banking chatbot platform acquired by Glia in June 2022. Raised $17.5M before exit. Partnered with ATB Financial, BECU, United FCU, EQ Bank, Civista Bank, Truist Momentum. Now powers Glia's Conversational AI Center of Excellence in Vancouver. Turnkey virtual assistants for banks and credit unions. Founded 2014. Leadership joined Glia to develop AI automation solutions.

name: Abe AI
summary: Abe AI (now part of Envestnet | Yodlee) provides conversational AI for banking across voice and messaging including Alexa and Siri. Virtual Financial Assistant (VFA) offers 4 tiers from basic requests to proactive financial wellness. Implementations deploy in weeks vs. months. Pre-built for financial industry with compliance tracking for regulators. Orlando-based. Banks get analytics on customer habits with real-time notifications.

name: Numerai
summary: Numerai operates a crowdsourced hedge fund where thousands of data scientists submit encrypted predictions that are combined into a meta-model. Manages $450M+ in AUM and returned 25% in 2024. Unique model: participants stake NMR tokens on their predictions, earning rewards for accuracy. Secured a $500M commitment from J.P. Morgan to deploy capital into its strategies. Valued at $500M with backing from Union Square Ventures and Placeholder.

name: SigFig
summary: SigFig provides white-label robo-advisory technology that banks embed into their own platforms. Pivoted from B2C to B2B in 2015, now powering automated investment services for Wells Fargo, UBS, and regional banks. Features include portfolio management, rebalancing, tax-loss harvesting, and goal tracking. Platform integrates directly into bank dashboards so customers can invest without leaving their existing accounts. UBS made a strategic equity investment.

name: Nitrogen (fka Riskalyze)
summary: Riskalyze (now Nitrogen Wealth) is the leading risk tolerance platform for financial advisors, trusted by tens of thousands of advisors. Uses Nobel Prize-winning methodology to generate Risk Numbers on a 1-99 scale. 85% of firms with dedicated client engagement platforms choose Nitrogen. 75% of advisors grew their book by $1M+ within 90 days of adoption. Founded 2011.

name: Nansen
summary: Nansen provides blockchain analytics with labeled wallet data, allowing users to track smart money movements and identify trends before they hit mainstream. Has labeled over 300M wallets across 40+ chains. Raised $89M from a16z and Accel at a $750M valuation. Customers include major crypto funds, exchanges, and DeFi protocols. Acquired staking infrastructure provider Stakewithus in 2024 to expand into institutional services.

name: Kabbage (Amex)
summary: Kabbage was a pioneering AI-powered SMB lender acquired by American Express for ~$850M in 2020 (now AmEx Business Blueprint). Processed 297,000+ PPP loans during COVID—second-largest PPP lender. Tech and team powers AmEx's $1K-$150K credit lines for small businesses. Founded 2009, raised $489M equity from SoftBank and others.

name: OnDeck (Enova)
summary: OnDeck was a pioneering online small business lender acquired by Enova (NYSE: ENVA) for ~$122M in 2020. Raised $394M from First Round, Khosla, Tiger Global, Goldman Sachs, Peter Thiel. IPO'd 2014. Provided $14B+ loans across 700 industries in US, Canada, Australia. Post-acquisition portfolio generated $200M+ cash. Now over 50% of Enova's portfolio. Founded 2006 in NYC by Mitch Jacobs.

name: Fundbox
summary: Fundbox is building the first B2B payments and credit network for SMBs. $410M+ equity raised at $1.1B valuation (2021) from HOOPP, Allianz X, Khosla. 150,000+ SMBs have accessed $6B+ in capital. Uses AI to underwrite against the $21T B2B commerce market, unlocking the $1T+ tied up in SMB accounts receivable. Founded 2012 by Eyal Shinar.

name: Clearco
summary: Clearco provides revenue-based financing for ecommerce and SaaS companies. Advanced $2.5B+ to 10,000+ businesses. Raised $1B+ including SoftBank-led rounds, then restructured after 2022 difficulties with $60M Series D (2023). Tripled advances in 2024 under new CEO. Founded by Michele Romanow. Recovering after layoffs and leadership changes.

name: Petal (Empower)
summary: Petal built credit cards for consumers with thin or no credit files using cash flow underwriting. Acquired by Empower Finance in April 2024 after struggling with high rates. Peaked at $800M valuation (Jan 2022), raised $700M+ in equity and debt. CashScore technology spun out as Prism Data (May 2023), informed nearly $2B in credit originations.

name: Argyle
summary: Argyle provides consumer-permissioned income and employment verification via API. Raised $30M Series C (2024) from Rockefeller, Bain Capital, $100M+ total. Covers 90% of US workforce with 1.6M+ annual verifications. 140+ customers including 8 of top 10 mortgage lenders. Hit rates 4-5x higher than credit bureaus. Named Fast Company Most Innovative Company 2024.

name: Truework (Checkr)
summary: Truework provides instant income and employment verification for lenders. Raised $125M+ at ~$480M valuation from Sequoia, Khosla, Activant. Acquired by Checkr in April 2025. Serves 8 of 10 largest mortgage lenders. Instant network of 48M active employees. Founded 2017 by ex-Opendoor team Ryan Sandler and Ethan Winchell. HousingWire Tech100 2025 winner.

name: Hive AI (Crypto)
tagline: AI agent for DeFi trading on Solana
summary: The Hive (BUZZ) is a network of composable DeFi agents on Solana with natural language interface. Won Solana AI Hackathon ($60K from SendAI, Jan 2025). 400+ entries from 95 countries competed. Agents handle trading, staking, liquidity, sentiment analysis. Built by Jason Hedman. Hit $0.186 ATH Jan 2025. Part of DeFAI movement where AI agents sector grew from $4.8B to $15.5B in Q4 2024.

name: Cookie DAO
summary: Cookie DAO is the data layer for AI agents, tracking mindshare and performance via cookie.fun. Aggregates 7TB+ of on-chain and social data. 100K users in 3 weeks of Nov 2024 launch. Hit $0.76 ATH Jan 2025. ~$78M market cap. Competes with Kaito in InfoFi sector. Token sales June 2024. Available on Base, Ethereum, and BNB Chain. Expanding beyond AI to broader crypto intelligence in Q2 2025.

name: Sekoia
summary: SEKOIA is an automated AI-powered VC platform investing in AI agents on Virtuals Protocol. Uses ML for real-time evaluation and smart contracts for automated capital deployment. Peaked at $55M market cap Dec 2024, hit $0.086 ATH Jan 2025. 986M circulating of 1B max supply. Projects submit via Telegram; evaluation engine scores trust and AI metrics. Focuses on many small predictable returns vs. unicorn hunting.

name: Motive (Formerly KeepTruckin)
summary: Motive (formerly KeepTruckin) provides fleet management software combining ELD compliance, AI dashcams, telematics, and spend management. Serves nearly 100K clients and has prevented 170K collisions through its AI safety features. Valued at $2.85B after raising $717M from Insight Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and Alphabet's GV. Filed for IPO in late 2025 with $115M quarterly revenue growing 23% YoY. Recently launched a corporate credit card and freight matching platform.

name: Magnifi
tagline: Conversational AI copilot for portfolio auditing and thematic investment discovery
summary: Magnifi by TIFIN is an AI investment copilot for retail investors. $2B+ in linked self-directed assets (June 2024). Uses GPT + Morningstar/FRED data. Features: idea generation, portfolio health checks, buy/sell impact analysis, cross-account monitoring. Part of TIFIN (backed by JP Morgan, Morningstar, Franklin Templeton). TIFIN sold 55ip to JP Morgan. Founded 2018 by Isabelle Freidheim and TIFIN's Vinay Nair.

name: Personal Capital (Empower)
tagline: AI-powered wealth management with human advisors (acquired by Empower)
summary: Personal Capital was acquired by Empower for ~$1B in 2020, bringing 2.5M users and $12.2B AUM. Now operates as Empower Personal Wealth, which surpassed $100B AUA in Oct 2025 with 25% CAGR since 2023 launch. Digital dashboard and hybrid advisory model live on under Empower brand. Founded 2009 by PayPal co-founder Bill Harris.

name: Blooom
summary: Blooom was a 401(k) robo-advisor that shut down Nov 2022 and sold tech to Morgan Stanley. Had 29K clients with $5.6B in assets. Staff including CEO moved to Morgan Stanley. Raised $17.5M+ total. Founded in Overland Park, Kansas by Chris Costello and Randy AufDerHeide. Managed 401(k), 403(b), TSP, and IRA accounts. Former customers returned to recordkeepers after shutdown.

name: Titan
tagline: AI-powered active investing with hedge fund strategies
summary: Titan brings hedge fund-style active investment strategies to retail investors with no accreditation required and a $100 minimum. Manages over $1B in AUM across 35K+ clients. Raised $100M Series C at a ~$1B valuation; backed by a16z, General Catalyst, and celebrities including Kevin Durant and Will Smith. Charges $25/month plus 0.20% advisory fee. Targets younger investors looking for an alternative to pure passive indexing or high-risk day trading.

name: Black Ore
tagline: AI tax prep platform for CPAs with 90% time savings
summary: Black Ore is an AI tax prep platform for CPAs claiming 90% time savings. Raised $60M from a16z, Oak HC/FT, Founders Fund, General Catalyst, Khosla. Angels include Vikram Pandit (ex-Citi CEO) and Max Levchin (PayPal/Affirm). Tax Autopilot handles 1040s, generates returns and workpapers in seconds vs. days. SOC-2 compliant. GA early 2024. Based in Austin, founded 2022.

name: Filed
tagline: AI automates tax prep within existing software
summary: Filed is an AI tax preparer that works inside existing software (CCH Axcess, UltraTax, Lacerte, Drake). Raised $17.2M pre-seed/seed from Northzone, Day One Ventures, J Ventures, Neo, Raine. Processes 3x more returns without new hires. Customers cut turnaround from 7 days to overnight. Tens of thousands of returns processed Q1 2025. Review cycles reduced 30-50%. Automates full return lifecycle.

name: FlyFin
tagline: AI finds deductions for freelancers and 1099 workers
summary: FlyFin is the first AI-powered tax engine for freelancers and 1099 workers, combining AI with human CPAs. Raised $8M from Accel Partners. 250K+ users saving average $7,800 more than previous years. Launched FlyFin TaxGPT on GPT-4. Targeting $23B US tax prep market with 70M+ freelancers (growing to 86.5M by 2027). Founded 2020.

name: Inkle
tagline: Tax and compliance automation for US startups
summary: Inkle automates tax and compliance for US cross-border startups. Raised $1.5M pre-seed from Picus Capital, Saison Capital, Force Ventures. 500+ startups including 5%+ of YC companies, half of YC India companies. 7x revenue growth last year.
