Handles bookkeeping, state/federal filings, sales tax, registered agent, mailroom. Expanding to US-Canada, US-LATAM, and crypto taxes. Founded 2022 in SF.

name: DataSnipper
tagline: AI audit automation platform for auditors
summary: DataSnipper builds AI-powered audit automation that plugs into Excel, used by 400K+ auditors across 125 countries including all Big Four firms. Reached unicorn status in early 2024 with a $100M Series B from Index Ventures at $1B valuation. Revenue grew 150% in 2023 and was named the fastest-growing company in the Netherlands two years running. Delivered $1.4B in productivity savings in 2025. Partnered with Microsoft to launch AI agents for audit and finance.

name: Stampli
tagline: AI-powered accounts payable with Billy the Bot
summary: Stampli is the #1-rated AP automation platform, processing $85B+ invoices annually for 1,600+ customers. Raised $61M from Blackstone. Billy the Bot, launched 2015, auto-codes invoices and handles PO matching with 'Cognitive AI' (2024). G2's Top 100 Best Software globally, #2 in Accounting & Finance. 98/100 satisfaction. Saves customers 25x efficiency gains.

name: Trullion
summary: Trullion is an AI-powered accounting platform for lease accounting (ASC 842/IFRS 16), revenue recognition, and audit. Backed by Aleph, Third Point Ventures, Greycroft, StepStone. Launched Trulli agentic AI assistant (May 2025) and Audit Suite (Sep 2024). Customers report 90% time savings and 25% reduction in manual work. Founded 2019 in NYC/Tel Aviv by Isaac Heller (ex-Visual Lease) and Amir Boldo (ex-8200).

name: Salient
tagline: AI agents for auto loan collections and servicing
summary: Salient provides AI voice agents for auto loan servicing and collections. Raised $60M Series A (July 2025) from a16z, Matrix Partners, Y Combinator at $350M valuation. Processed $1B+ in transactions since 2023 launch. Customers include Westlake Financial, Consumer Portfolio Services, American Credit Acceptance. Reduces handle times 60%. Founded 2023.

name: January
summary: January is an AI-driven humane debt collection platform. Raised $22M+ total including $12M Series B (Dec 2023) led by IA Ventures with Upper90, Shrug Capital. 150x more efficient than traditional agencies. Top performer for 90%+ of clients. 4.7-star Google rating, 90%+ CSAT. Outperforms traditional agencies by 30%. Works with banks, credit unions, BNPL lenders, debt buyers. Millions of borrowers served.

name: Skit.ai
tagline: AI voice agents for debt collection across channels
summary: Skit.ai provides AI voice agents for debt collection in the ARM industry. Raised $47.6M total (Series B) from WestBridge Capital and others. Automated 1B+ spoken conversations, resolved $1B+ in accounts. 40% cost reduction and 20% opex decrease for clients. Customers include American Finance, Collections Bureau of America, Uown Leasing. Omnichannel: voice, SMS, email, chat. Won 2024 AI Excellence Award. Founded 2016 in Bengaluru.

name: PAIR Finance
tagline: Machine learning-driven debt collection in Europe
summary: PAIR Finance is the leading AI-powered debt collection company in Europe. Founded 2016 in Berlin, raised ~$10M total ($5.3M Series A 2017, $2.25M 2020 led by Zalando). Acquired by Pollen Street Capital in Oct 2022. Uses AI and behavioral science for ethical collections. Expanded to Sweden (2024), Poland and Portugal (2025). Ranks #2 among 217 competitors in category. Investors include FinLeap, Yabeo Capital, Zalando.

name: TrueAccord
summary: TrueAccord pioneered digital-first debt collection using machine learning to determine optimal communication timing, channel, and tone for each consumer. Founded by a former Klarna executive who experienced traditional collections firsthand. The company's patented Heartbeat ML engine analyzes millions of interactions to personalize outreach. Clients include fintech companies and banks; raised $75M+ in funding. Reports significantly higher recovery rates than traditional call-center approaches.

name: Symend
tagline: Predictive analytics for customer retention in collections
summary: Symend uses behavioral science and AI to optimize debt collection through personalized customer engagement. Raised $140M total including $42M growth round (2022) from Inovia Capital. Symend Scores track 100+ real-time behavioral signals to predict repayment likelihood. Clients include auto lenders like Rifco (26.6% self-cure rate from email outreach). Founded 2016 in Calgary.

name: InDebted
tagline: AI collections platform for global markets
summary: InDebted provides AI-powered digital debt collection serving clients like Zip, Klarna, and Cash Converters. Raised $60M Series C (Sept 2024) at ~$240M USD valuation, $105M total. 110% CAGR, operationally profitable since Feb 2024. Delivers up to 40% better recovery; highest-rated collections platform for CX. Founded 2016 in Sydney. Expanding to US, Europe, South America.

name: CollBox
summary: CollBox is a collections platform connecting SMBs with vetted debt collection agencies. Founded 2015 in Austin. Raised $1M seed (2019) from Capital Factory, Alamo Angels, Bala Investments. Recovered $10M+ in past-due invoices for customers. Free platform with commission-only model (agencies keep ~25% of recovered funds). Integrates with QuickBooks. Solves the $800B annual unpaid invoice problem for small businesses.

name: Attunely
tagline: AI platform for debt collection optimization
summary: Attunely was a Seattle-based ML platform for debt collection optimization. Founded 2018. Raised $13M total: $3.7M seed (2019), $9.4M Series A (Nov 2020) led by Framework Venture Partners. Investors included Anthos Capital, Pioneer Square Labs. Company ceased operations after 2022. Platform used machine learning to optimize revenue recovery strategies and collector workflows.

name: C&R Software
tagline: AI collections managing $8T+ in accounts globally
summary: C&R Software is an enterprise AI debt collection platform managing $8T+ in accounts globally. 500K+ users across major financial institutions: trusted by 5 of top 10 UK banks, 7 of top 15 US banks. Cloud-native Debt Manager platform with FitLogic AI decisioning. Customers see 20-35% operational efficiency gains, 15-25% improvement in collection rates. Built on AWS with enterprise security.

name: Kiavi
tagline: AI-powered loans for real estate investors (formerly LendingHome)
summary: Kiavi (formerly LendingHome) provides fix-and-flip and rental loans to real estate investors. First private lender to fund 100K loans, totaling $30B+ in cumulative volume. Record $6.5B originated in 2024, up 46% YoY despite home sales hitting 30-year lows. Serves 5,500+ active customers across 49 states. Closed nearly $2B in securitizations in 2024 and launched a new construction financing product.

name: Beeline (MagicBlocks)
tagline: Bob AI for mortgage sales automation
summary: Beeline (MagicBlocks) is an AI-powered mortgage sales platform. Part of Beeline Holdings (NASDAQ: BLNE). Bob AI chatbot launched June 2023 delivers 6X higher lead conversion than human agents. Raised $5M (Feb 2025) with CEO investing $2.9M. MagicBlocks subsidiary (47.6% owned) has 18+ clients globally. Bob 2.0 generated $162K revenue in Q2 2025 alone. Expanding beyond mortgage into multi-industry AI sales agents.

name: Metropolis
tagline: AI computer vision for checkout-free parking
summary: Metropolis is an AI computer vision platform enabling checkout-free payments. Founded 2017. Raised $3.5B+ total (debt + equity) including $500M Series D (Nov 2025) at $5B valuation. Acquired SP Plus for ~$1.5B (May 2024) becoming largest parking operator in North America. 4,200+ locations, $5B+ annual transactions, 50M customers. Acquired Oosto (2025). #13 CNBC Disruptor 50.

name: EliseAI
summary: EliseAI automates leasing communications for multifamily property managers via voice, text, email, and chat. Works with 70% of the top 50 multifamily owners and is active in 1 of every 12 US apartment units. Valued at $2.2B after raising $250M Series E from a16z in 2025. Partners include Brookfield, AvalonBay, Equity Residential, and Invitation Homes. Expanded into healthcare in 2023. ARR grew 2.5x between 2023 and 2024.

name: Keyway
summary: Keyway is an AI-powered commercial real estate investment platform. Founded 2020 in NYC. Raised $43M+ including $25M Series A (June 2022). Works with Blackstone, Brookfield, Goldman Sachs. Multi-agent platform with KeyComps, KeyDocs, KeyBrain for automated deal analysis. Started licensing to third-party brokerages in 2024. Investors include Camber Creek, Graph Ventures, FJ Labs, Thomvest Ventures.

name: Home365
summary: Home365 is an AI-powered property management platform for single-family rentals. Founded 2016. Raised $70M total: $26M Series B (March 2022) led by Viola Growth at $500M valuation. Manages $1.5B+ in assets across 7,000 properties in 17 cities. Uses AI to predict maintenance via 40+ data points. R&D center in Israel. Investors include Verizon, Samsung Next, Greensoil PropTech, Lool Ventures.

name: Casavo
tagline: AI-powered instant home buying in Europe
summary: Casavo was Europe's first iBuyer, pivoting in 2024 to real estate technology and valuation services. Raised $817M+ total including $20M (Aug 2024) led by UniCredit. Peak $400M valuation (2022) with $300M debt facility to buy properties. $249M revenue (2023). Founded 2017 in Milan, operates in Italy, Spain, Portugal.

name: Entera
tagline: AI for real estate investment decisions
summary: Entera is an AI-powered platform for single-family rental (SFR) investors. Founded in Austin. Raised $32M Series A (June 2021) plus $7.5M additional funding (Nov 2023). Processes 1,000+ transactions/month across 24+ US markets. Platform streamlines discovery, acquisition, and management of single-family homes with AI-driven analytics and automation.

name: CompStak
tagline: AI-driven commercial real estate data analytics
summary: CompStak provides crowdsourced commercial real estate lease and sales data covering 1.5M properties and 35B sqft. Raised $50M Series C from Morgan Stanley Expansion Capital. 30K+ members contribute data; paying clients include Wells Fargo, Morgan Stanley, Google, Tishman Speyer, and Moody's. AI-driven analytics platform for lenders and investors.

name: Mapped
tagline: AI data layer for commercial real estate
summary: Mapped is an AI-powered data layer unifying building systems for commercial real estate. Founded 2019 by Shaun Cooley in El Segundo, CA. Raised $40M+ total including $25.5M from 14 investors. Investors include Greycroft, Honeywell Ventures, NTT DoCoMo Ventures, Singtel Innov8, Allegion Ventures. Automates discovery and normalization of data from building sensors, systems, and IoT devices via single API.

name: Rocket Money (Rocket Companies)
tagline: AI finds and cancels unused subscriptions
summary: Rocket Money (formerly Truebill) finds and cancels unwanted subscriptions, tracks spending, and negotiates bills. Acquired by Rocket Companies for $1.275B in cash (Dec 2021). YC W16. Had 2.5M members analyzing $50B monthly transactions at acquisition. Premium membership unlocks auto-savings and budgets. Rebranded to Rocket Money Aug 2022.

name: Origin Financial
tagline: AI financial advisor with CFP access
summary: Origin is the first SEC-regulated AI financial advisor. Founded 2019 in San Francisco. Raised $68M total ($56M Series B Aug 2021) at $400M valuation. AI scores 98.3% on CFP-style exams vs 85% for human CFPs. Named Forbes Best Budgeting App (July 2024). Combines AI with access to human advisors. Investors include Felicis, General Catalyst, Founders Fund, 01A.

name: Digit (Oportun)
summary: Digit uses AI to analyze spending patterns and automatically move small amounts into savings without manual effort. Helped users save over $7B and pay off $300M in debt. Acquired by Oportun in Dec 2021 for $211M ($112.6M cash + $98.5M stock). Founded 2013 by Ethan Bloch, launched automated savings in 2015. Continues as business unit within Oportun (Nasdaq: OPRT).

name: AU10TIX
tagline: AI-powered ID authentication and fraud prevention
summary: AU10TIX is a global leader in identity verification, preventing an estimated $7.5B in fraud in 2024 ($24B since 2021). Subsidiary of ICTS International (OTCQB: ICTSF). The only 100% automated global ID system with consortium-based detection across 60+ major companies. Serves payments, crypto, social media, and shared economy. Founded 2002 in Tel Aviv.

name: Incode
tagline: AI identity verification with deepfake detection
summary: Incode provides AI identity verification with industry-leading deepfake detection. Their Deepsight system was independently validated by Purdue as the most accurate commercial deepfake detector with 2.5x lower false-acceptance rates. Processed 4.1B identity checks in 2024; clients include ByteDance, Nubank, PNC, and Scotiabank. Achieved unicorn status at $1.25B valuation. Acquired AuthenticID to expand capabilities as deepfake fraud attempts rose 900% from 2022-2024.

name: Shufti Pro
summary: Shufti Pro provides AI-powered KYC, KYB, and AML screening in 230+ countries. Raised $20M Series A. Verifies 10,000+ ID document types in 150+ languages. AML screening covers 1,700+ watchlists with 30-60 second results. GDPR, PCI DSS, and Cyber Essentials certified. Six international offices since founding in 2017. Serves fintech, e-commerce, crypto.

name: Didit
tagline: AI-native identity verification with free tier
summary: Didit is an AI-native identity verification platform with free core KYC. Founded 2023 in Barcelona. Raised $2M, joined Y Combinator (W26 batch). Growing 20%+ MoM with strong retention. Prepaid credit model starting at $0.15/check. Covers KYC, AML, age verification, proof of address. SantanderX investor. Launched V1 in Aug 2024. Competes with Incode, Yoti.

name: Identomat
summary: Identomat is an AI-powered KYC/AML platform with video verification. Founded 2019 by Georgian founders. Raised $3.2M seed (largest Georgian-founded startup seed round). 60+ enterprise customers including TBC Bank, Bank of Georgia, government ministries. iBeta Level 2 certified biometrics. Supports 8,000+ ID types globally. 27-person team. HQ in Champaign, Illinois.

name: NEAR Protocol
summary: NEAR Protocol is building 'User-Owned AI' infrastructure where users own their models, data, and value. Co-founded by Illia Polosukhin, co-author of the influential Transformers paper behind ChatGPT. Launched NEAR AI R&D lab and is developing a 1.4 trillion parameter decentralized model. Deutsche Telekom operates a validator on the network. Joined NVIDIA Inception Program for enterprise AI. Features AI-native 'Intents' for autonomous blockchain transactions.

name: Internet Computer (ICP)
tagline: Blockchain for running AI models on-chain
summary: Internet Computer (ICP) is the only blockchain running large AI models entirely on-chain. Founded by DFINITY, led by Dominic Williams. Deployed GPT-2 LLM on-chain in 2024 via DecideAI. WebAssembly VM enables near-native performance with deterministic SIMD. Caffeine AI integration (2025) allows app generation via natural language. Chain Fusion enables cross-chain interoperability.

name: Akash Network
summary: Akash Network is a decentralized GPU cloud marketplace offering 60-70% cost reduction vs AWS. Q4 2024: 577 GPUs (+269% YoY), $742K lease revenue (+565% YoY). Supports NVIDIA H100, A100, and integrating Blackwell B200/B300. Raising $75M via Starbonds for 7,200 GB200 GPUs. CEO Greg Osuri named CoinDesk Most Influential 2024.

name: SingularityDAO (SDAO)
summary: SingularityDAO pioneered AI-managed crypto portfolios called DynaSets - diversified baskets rebalanced by AI traders. First spinoff from SingularityNET. Initial beta raised ~$3M in token contributions. In Oct 2024, merged with Cogito Finance and SelfKey to form Singularity Finance (SFI), focusing on tokenizing the AI economy. 1:1 SDAO to SFI conversion. Current market cap ~$2M with 83M tokens circulating.

name: Oraichain
summary: Oraichain is the first AI-powered oracle and Layer 1 blockchain. Founded 2020 by Chung Dao. Market cap ~$22M with 13.8M ORAI circulating (max 19.78M). AI Marketplace with 100+ APIs. Upgraded to Cosmos SDK v0.50.1 (Nov 2024). Launched LFG meme trading app with $1M incentives (July 2025). Expanding oracle services to Solana, BNB Chain. 16% staking APR. Competes with Chainlink, Fetch.ai.

name: Cortex (CTXC)
summary: Cortex is a blockchain enabling on-chain machine learning execution. Founded by Ziqi Chen and Jia Tian. Cortex Virtual Machine (CVM) uses GPU for ML inference, EVM-compatible. PoW consensus. Market cap ~$2.5-8M (highly volatile). Delisted from OKX (June 2025) and ONUS (April 2025). No major protocol updates since 2020. Enables AI models in smart contracts for DApps.

name: Qubic
summary: Qubic is a Layer-1 blockchain using 'Useful Proof of Work' that channels compute power to AI training. Market cap ~$99M, ranked #453. 133T tokens circulating (200T max). August 2025 halving cut emissions 50%. Briefly controlled 51% of Monero hashrate. Showcased at MERGE Madrid 2025. 2025 roadmap: Tier 1 exchange listings, MetaMask integration, EVM compatibility, 15.5M TPS NFT platform.

name: GiniMachine
summary: GiniMachine is a no-code AI credit scoring SaaS platform. Founded 2016 in Vilnius, Lithuania by Ivan Kovalenko. Backed by Elevator Lab. Pricing from €100/month. Builds predictive ML models in minutes without coding or statistics knowledge. Monitors model performance and alerts for retraining needs. Competes with Zest AI, Scienaptic Systems, Borrowell.

name: Peratera
summary: Peratera is a digital banking platform for cross-border payments and global business expansion. Founded 2021 in Auckland, New Zealand. Virtual accounts across 190+ countries, 50+ currencies. Supports SEPA Instant, Faster Payments, ACH, SWIFT. AI-powered anti-fraud monitoring 24/7. Issues Visa/MasterCard physical and virtual cards. Serves fintech, e-commerce, digital businesses.

name: Finpilot
summary: Finpilot is a 'ChatGPT for financial questions' serving analysts and fund managers. Seattle-based, founded by Lakshay Chauhan and John Alberg. Raised $4.5M total ($4M seed Feb 2024 led by Madrona, Ascend VC). In-house finance-specific LLM processes SEC filings, transcripts, reports. Targets endowments, foundations, pension funds, OCIOs, family offices.

name: 9fin
summary: 9fin provides AI-powered intelligence for debt capital markets covering high-yield bonds, leveraged loans, CLOs, and private credit. First in the sector to deploy generative AI for agentic Q&A across documents. Raised $50M Series B from Highland Europe in 2024 after 400% ARR growth. Serves nearly 200 clients including 9 of the top 10 investment banks and asset managers with $17T+ combined AUM. Founded by ex-JPMorgan and Deutsche Bank credit professionals.

name: Rogo
tagline: AI chatbot for investment banking research
summary: Rogo builds AI research tools for investment bankers, automating meeting prep, company profiling, and market research. Raised $50M Series B from Thrive Capital, J.P. Morgan, and Tiger Global at a $350M valuation, bringing total funding to $75M. Has served 5,000+ bankers at public investment banks and mega-cap PE firms; saves analysts 10+ hours per week. ARR grew 27x. Founded by a former Lazard banker; backed by Eric Schmidt and Khosla Ventures.

name: Daloopa
summary: Daloopa uses AI to extract financial data from SEC filings, investor presentations, and press releases. Raised $56M+ total with $18M round in 2024 from Morgan Stanley, Pavilion Capital. Covers 3,500+ public companies with 13 years history. ~300 employees serving hedge funds, PE firms, and investment banks. Integrated with Claude for Financial Services.

name: Dataminr
tagline: AI for real-time event and risk detection
summary: Dataminr detects high-impact events and emerging risks in real-time using 50+ proprietary LLMs analyzing 1M+ public data sources. Valued at $4.1B with $1.5B+ raised; hit $222M revenue in 2024. Serves two-thirds of the Fortune 50, 100+ US government agencies, and partners with NATO for global threat detection. Their ReGenAI delivers continuously updating situational briefs with 99.5% accuracy as events unfold.

name: Visible Alpha (S&P Global)
summary: Visible Alpha provides deep consensus estimates with 200M+ data points across 170+ industries. Acquired by S&P Global (May 2024). Covers 7,300+ companies with 156 line items per company average. Backed by UBS, Morgan Stanley, Wells Fargo, Jefferies as both investors and data contributors. Now integrated into S&P Capital IQ Pro platform. Founded 2015 in NYC.

name: Koyfin
summary: Koyfin is a Bloomberg-alternative financial terminal trusted by 500K+ investors. Raised $6.7M from Craft Ventures, Valor Equity Partners. Covers stocks, ETFs, funds, yields, currencies, commodities, crypto with advanced charting and screening. Professional/retail split evenly. 11-50 employees. Founded 2015 in NYC by Rob Koyfman. Much more affordable than institutional terminals.

name: Tabs
summary: Tabs is an AI-powered B2B accounts receivable platform. Raised $91M+ total: $55M Series B (Lightspeed), $25M Series A (General Catalyst), $7M seed. 200+ customers with 5x ARR growth, $1B+ annual invoice volume automated. Customers include Cursor, Statsig, Findigs, Pinata. 40% reduction in collection time. Automates contract review, invoicing, payments, revenue recognition. Founded 2023 in NYC.

name: Cube
summary: Cube is a spreadsheet-native FP&A platform for CFOs, enabling multi-scenario planning and performance tracking. Raised $65M+ (Series C) from Battery Ventures, Mayfield, Singapore Telecom. $20M funding in 2024 to expand AI/ML capabilities. Customers include Mercari, Harness, and Bank Novo. Founded 2018 in NYC by ex-Workday team.

name: Datarails
summary: Datarails is an FP&A platform for Excel users. Raised $105M+ total: $55M Series A (Zeev Ventures) and $50M Series B (Qumra Capital, 2022). Launched FP&A Genius ChatGPT-style chatbot (Mar 2023) for conversational financial analysis. #92 on Deloitte Fast 500 2024. Also offers Cash Management solution. Founded 2015 in Tel Aviv by Didi Gurfinkel, Eyal Cohen, and Oded Har-Tal.

name: Mosaic Tech
tagline: AI for FP&A and scenario modeling
summary: Mosaic is a strategic finance platform for FP&A. Raised $72M+ total: $26M Series C (OMERS Ventures) and $25M Series B (Founders Fund, General Catalyst). #1 in G2's 50 Best Accounting & Finance 2024. Customers: Pipe, Fivetran, Drata, Sourcegraph, Kandji. AI features include automated forecasts and metric analysis. Founded 2019 by ex-Palantir finance leaders Bijan Moallemi, Brian Campbell, Joe Garafalo.

name: Jirav
summary: Jirav is an FP&A platform for SMBs and accounting firms. Raised $33M total including $20M Series B (Cota Capital, 2023). 4,000+ customers across SaaS, life sciences, CPG, e-commerce. 70 employees. Launched AI Forecasting product Sep 2024. New CEO Michael Morrison joined 2024. Competes with Cube. FP&A market expected to hit $16.9B by 2031. Founded 2015 in Austin.

name: Prophix
summary: Prophix is a financial performance platform serving 3,000+ global customers. Hit $100M ARR in 2022, backed by Hg Capital. Launched Prophix One platform in 2024 at flagship conference with 500 attendees. G2 Leader in Enterprise CPM. Named customers include USA Properties Fund, Lee Company. Founded 1987 in Mississauga, Canada.

name: Orum (Stripe)
summary: Orum provides a unified API for instant money movement across RTP, FedNow, Same Day ACH, and wires. Raised $82M from Accel, Bain Capital, AmEx Ventures. Acquired by Stripe (July 2025) to strengthen real-time payments. Verify product enables instant bank account validation under 15 seconds. Founded 2019 by ex-LearnVest CEO Stephany Kirkpatrick.

name: Ampla (FundThrough)
summary: Ampla provided working capital and banking for consumer brands. Acquired by FundThrough (Apr 2025). $2B+ loan originations, $5T+ transaction volume. Raised $50M equity ($40M Series A from VMG, Forerunner) + $330M debt. Founded 2019 in NYC by Anthony Santomo. Now part of FundThrough platform.

name: Wayflyer
summary: Wayflyer provides revenue-based financing from $5K-$20M for ecommerce brands, deploying capital in as little as 24 hours without personal guarantees. Has deployed $3B+ to 3,500+ customers. Valued at $1.6B after a 2022 funding round led by DST Global and QED. Secured $1B facility from Neuberger Berman in 2023. Achieved monthly profitability in late 2023 and was named Ireland's fastest-growing tech company in 2024.

name: Vicarious
summary: Vicarious provides AI-powered music royalty financing for artists and catalogs. Part of $5B+ music rights investment market (2024). Competes with Royalty Exchange, SongVest, Jukebox. Uses AI to value catalogs and forecast streaming trends. Enables artists to monetize catalogs without giving up ownership. Music royalty securitization growing: Hipgnosis $1.5B ABS, Concord $850M ABS in 2024.

name: Gabi (Experian)
summary: Gabi is an AI insurance comparison platform acquired by Experian for $320M (Nov 2021). Uses AI to predict quotes and automatically comparison shops across 40+ insurers. Covers auto, home, renters insurance. Project A exited after investing at pre-seed. Experian expanded into home insurance via acquisition. Founded 2016 in SF. Now operates under Experian's insurance marketplace.

name: Jerry
tagline: AI car insurance and car buying app
summary: Jerry is an AI-powered car ownership super app that helps users compare insurance, refinance car loans, and manage vehicle expenses. Serves 5M+ users as a licensed broker for ~4M customers; saves users an average of $800/year on insurance. Raised $233M total including $110M Series C2 in 2023 from Park West, Goodwater, and Highland Capital. Valued at $450M+ after consecutive up rounds.

name: Ethos
summary: Ethos offers online life insurance using 300K+ data points to underwrite policies without medical exams, starting at $8/month. Raised $414M from Sequoia, Accel, GV, SoftBank (peak $2.7B valuation 2021). IPO filed Sept 2025, pricing at $1.26B valuation—listing on Nasdaq as LIFE. $277.5M revenue, $46.6M profit (9mo 2025). Backed by Jay-Z, Kevin Durant, Robert Downey Jr.

name: Newfront
summary: Newfront is an AI-powered commercial insurance brokerage that hit $300M revenue in 2024 with 729 employees. Raised $312M total including $200M Series D (2022) at $2.2B valuation. Provides business insurance, employee benefits, and retirement services through data-driven digital dashboards. Founded 2017 in San Francisco.

name: At-Bay
summary: At-Bay combines cyber insurance with proactive security monitoring through its Stance MDR platform. Insures 40K+ businesses protecting $800B in collective revenue. Valued at $1.35B after $258M in funding from Lightspeed and Icon Ventures. Hit $360M+ in gross written premium with 600% growth from 2020-2021. Expanded coverage to businesses with up to $5B revenue and $10M limits in 2024.

name: Kin
tagline: AI-first home insurance for risky areas
summary: Kin is a direct-to-consumer home insurer focused on catastrophe-prone states. Raised $286M equity total including $50M Series E (2025) at $2B valuation from QED Investors. $495M GWP and $156M revenue in 2024 with first profitable year. Serves 13 states covering $100B+ insured property value. $860M+ in catastrophe reinsurance secured.

name: Clearcover
summary: Clearcover is an AI-powered auto insurer that raised $560M+ at $1B valuation. ClearAI® processes eligible claims in as little as 30 minutes (record: 7 minutes). Launched generative AI for FNOL statement collection (2024). Partnership with Ada for 24/7 AI voice customer service. Named CNBC Top Insurtech 2024, Forbes Best Insurance 2025.

name: Openly
summary: Openly provides AI-powered premium homeowners insurance via independent agents. Raised $368M+ total: $193M growth round (Jan 2025, Eden Global/Allianz X) and $100M Series D (2023). 50K+ independent agent partners across 24 states. AI generates quotes from county records, aerial photos, home listings. Uses Ecopia AI for geocoding. Founded 2017 by insurance industry veterans in Boston.

name: Cowbell Cyber
summary: Cowbell provides AI-powered cyber insurance for SMEs with up to $1B revenue. Raised $202M total including $60M Series C from Zurich Insurance (2024). Submission-to-issue in under 5 minutes via continuous underwriting platform. Backed by 25+ global (re)insurers. Serves all 50 US states plus UK. Licensed producer network grew 3x over two years.

name: CoverGenius
summary: Cover Genius is a global embedded insurance platform. Raised $240M+ total including $70M Series D (2022, Dawn Capital) and Series E. 120M+ policies sold protecting 41M+ customers in 60+ countries. XCover API powers partners like Amazon, eBay, Booking.com, Ryanair, Shopify, Wayfair, Klarna. 107% YoY growth 2023, 145% NRR. $1.1M daily GWP. Founded 2014 in Sydney by Angus McDonald.

name: Cytora (Applied)
summary: Cytora provides AI-driven risk processing for commercial insurance underwriting. Raised $41M+ including £25M Series B (EQT Ventures). Acquired by Applied in Sep 2025. Customers: Allianz, Chubb, Starr, Beazley, Markel. Partners with Xapien, Kroll, Mitiga for enhanced risk analysis. Uses Google Cloud generative AI. Cambridge University spin-out founded 2014 by Richard Hartley.

name: Planck (Applied)
tagline: AI instant data for commercial underwriting
summary: Planck provides AI-powered instant data for commercial underwriting. Acquired by Applied Systems for $300M (July 2024). Raised $73M from Team8, Viola Fintech, Arbor, Eight Roads. Customers: AIG, Chubb, Allianz, Sompo. Planck PLUS uses GenAI to generate all underwriting insights from just business name and address in seconds. 80 employees in NYC/Tel Aviv. Founded 2016 by Elad Tsur.

name: Virtu Financial
summary: Virtu Financial is a publicly traded (VIRT) global market maker providing liquidity across equities, fixed income, currencies, crypto, and commodities. Generated $2.87B revenue in 2024, up 25% YoY, with Q4 trading income surging 104%. Operates two segments: Market Making and Execution Services. Maintains $914M cash position and has returned $1.3B to shareholders through buybacks since 2020.

name: Hudson River Trading
summary: Hudson River Trading is a quantitative trading firm that generated record $8B in net trading revenue in 2024, with ~1,200 employees across 14 offices globally ($8-10M revenue per employee). Founded by Harvard and MIT graduates in 2002. Expanding beyond traditional HFT into mid-frequency strategies; its Prism unit alone produced $2B+ last year. On track to exceed $12B revenue in 2025 after posting $3.7B in Q3 alone.

name: Optiver
summary: Optiver is an Amsterdam-based market maker trading derivatives, equities, ETFs, bonds, and FX on 100+ exchanges globally. Generated €3.5B revenue and €1.4B net profit in 2024 with 2,112 employees and €4.9B in equity. Founded in 1986 on the European Options Exchange. Expanding presence in China, India, and US capital markets. Known for highly competitive compensation with average UK staff receiving £468K.

name: Flow Traders
summary: Flow Traders is Europe's largest ETF market maker, publicly traded (Euronext Amsterdam). Provides liquidity for 13K+ ETP listings across NA, Europe, Asia Pacific. Expanded to crypto in 2019; now institutional-grade digital asset liquidity provider. Published 2024 Crypto ETP Report: global crypto ETP AUM hit $134.5B (+950% YoY). Partners: RULEMATCH, Bullish. Founded 2004 in Amsterdam. CEO Mike Kuehnel (2023).

name: AQR Capital
summary: AQR Capital is a quantitative investment manager founded by Cliff Asness in 1998. Rebounded from $95B AUM in 2022 to $179B in 2025 after adding a record $65B in a single year. Five-year annualized returns of 15-20%. Flagship Apex strategy manages $5.3B with 15.6% returns YTD. Known for systematic approach to alternative risk premia, managed futures, and long-short equity strategies.

name: Point72
summary: Point72 is Steve Cohen's multi-strategy hedge fund managing $41.5B with 3,000+ employees globally. Returned ~19% in 2024 and plans to return $3-5B to investors in 2025—its first capital return ever—after explosive growth. Cohen's net worth reached $21.3B in 2024. Expanding into private credit with a $1B+ target. Restructuring equities division in 2026 with new affiliate Valist Asset Management.

name: Man Group
summary: Man Group is the world's largest publicly traded hedge fund (LSE). $178B AUM (June 2024). Man AHL is its quant division with 150 investment professionals, 47 researchers. Developed AlphaGPT, an autonomous AI idea factory scanning research, earnings calls for alpha. Partnership with Oxford-Man Institute since 2007. Quant Hedge Fund of the Year (Risk.net). Founded 1783 in London. Man AHL founded 1987.

name: PDT Partners
summary: PDT Partners (Process Driven Trading) is a quant hedge fund founded by Peter Muller at Morgan Stanley in 1993, spun off in 2012. AUM grew from ~$10.8B (April 2024) to ~$14B (March 2025). Historically averaged 20%+ annual returns. Maintains prop-like culture, limiting capital to prioritize performance. Offices in NYC and London.

name: Millennium Management
summary: Millennium Management is a multi-strategy hedge fund managing $78B across 330+ investment teams. Returned 15% in 2024; founder Izzy Englander personally made $4B—the highest-earning hedge fund manager of the year. Since launching in 1989 with $35M, has only one down year (2008). Employs four major strategies: relative-value equity, equity arbitrage, fixed income, and quantitative. Englander remains sole owner.

name: Balyasny Asset Mgmt
summary: Balyasny Asset Management (BAM) is a multi-strategy hedge fund managing ~$29B AUM with 1,800+ investment professionals across 20+ global offices. Founded 2001 by Dmitry Balyasny. Diversified beyond equities into early-stage investing, commodities, and macro. Named Pensions & Investments Best Places to Work in Money Management 2024.

name: Marshall Wace
summary: Marshall Wace is one of the world's largest hedge funds managing $65B+ in 13F securities (Q1 2024). ~60% systematic (TOPS), ~40% fundamental (Eureka). Founded 1997 in London by Paul Marshall and Ian Wace with $50M seed from George Soros. Growing AUM rapidly with strong five-year returns. Offices in London and New York.

name: MoneyLion (Gen Digital)
summary: MoneyLion was a consumer finance super app offering banking, lending, and investing. Grew to 20.4M customers and $546M revenue (up 29%) in 2024. Acquired by Gen Digital (Apr 2025) for $82/share (~$1B) plus up to $23/share in CVRs. Previously public on NYSE: ML. Also operated embedded finance platform and media arm.

name: Addepar
summary: Addepar is a wealth management platform tracking $7T in assets across 1,200 client firms including RIAs, family offices, and banks. Raised $230M Series G at $3.25B valuation in 2025. Revenue estimated at $275M in 2024, up 31% YoY. Integrates with 350+ custodians across 45 countries. Added more AUM in 2024 than any prior year, including $180B from Itaú Private Bank. Serves clients in 40+ countries.

name: Ethic
summary: Ethic provides personalized sustainable investing through custom SMAs. $7B+ AUM across 250+ advisory and institutional firms. Series D funded. Direct indexing portfolios aligned with client values, financial goals, and tax needs. Single account solution with automated rebalancing and tax-smart strategies. Part of $52.5T US sustainable AUM market (US SIF 2024). Based in NYC.

name: Snappy Kraken
summary: Snappy Kraken provides AI-powered marketing automation for financial advisors. Raised $12.6M total including Series A (FINTOP). 7M+ AI-powered emails sent via OpenAI integration, 40% open rate (vs. industry average). 2024 Wealthie Award for Digital Campaign of the Year. ThinkAdvisor Luminaries for Excellence in Marketing. Founded 2016 in Ormond Beach by Robert Sofia.

name: TIFIN
summary: TIFIN is an AI innovation platform for wealth management. Raised $109M Series D (2022) at $842M valuation from Franklin Templeton, J.P. Morgan, Morningstar. SEI invested $10M (2024). Spun off multiple companies including 55ip (sold to J.P. Morgan). Founded by Dr. Vinay Nair. Portfolio includes Magnifi, TIFIN Wealth, TIFIN AG, and Helix.

name: Pontera
summary: Pontera enables advisors to manage clients' 401(k), 403(b), and other held-away retirement accounts. Raised $159M+ total including $60M from ICONIQ Growth. Partners with Commonwealth Financial Network and Stifel (200K+ clients). Engaged in public dispute with Fidelity over data access policies (2024). Formerly known as FeeX.

name: FINNY AI
summary: FINNY is an AI-powered prospecting platform for financial advisors. Founded March 2024 (YC-backed). Raised $21M+ total: $4.2M seed (Dec 2024) co-led by Maple VC/HNVR, plus $17M Series A (Dec 2025) led by Venrock. F-Score matching engine surfaces high-intent prospects. 400+ firms on platform. 50x revenue growth since Jan 2025. $7.7M new client assets/advisor annually average.

name: Hummingbird
summary: Hummingbird provides AI-powered AML and compliance software. Raised $41.8M total including $30M Series B (Battery Ventures). Acquired LogicLoop (Sep 2024) for data automation. Launched AI investigation product (Feb 2024). Partnered with PortX. Customers include BHG Financial and banks/fintechs needing streamlined BSA/AML. Founded 2016 in Boston by Jesse Reiss and Matt Van Buskirk.

name: Lucinity
summary: Lucinity is an AI-powered anti-money laundering (AML) compliance platform. Founded 2018 in Reykjavik, Iceland. Raised $25M+ total including $17M Series B led by Keen Venture Partners with Experian, Karma Ventures. Customers include Visa, Trustly, Tandem Bank. Microsoft Partner of Year Iceland (2024). Recognized in 2025 Gartner AML Market Guide. Increases compliance productivity 50%+.

name: Quantexa
summary: Quantexa provides decision intelligence that unifies data to detect fraud, AML violations, and financial crime. Raised $175M Series F at $2.6B valuation in 2025. Surpassed $100M ARR ('Centaur status')—seven times rarer than unicorn. Customers include HSBC, BNY Mellon, Standard Chartered, Vodafone, and the UK Cabinet Office. Deployed in 70+ countries with 800+ employees across 16 offices. Partners with Microsoft and Databricks.

name: ComplyAdvantage
summary: ComplyAdvantage provides AI-driven AML screening and transaction monitoring via its Mesh platform. Serves 1,000+ clients across 80+ countries including Santander UK and OakNorth Bank. Raised $88M including $50M Series C. Acquired Golden Recursion in 2024 to expand knowledge-graph capabilities. API-first architecture enables real-time payment screening and customer monitoring. Santander reported 50% faster onboarding after implementation.

name: Napier AI
summary: Napier AI is an AI-powered AML compliance platform. Founded 2015 in London. Raised $60M+ total: £45M from Crestline Investors (Feb 2024), majority investment from Marlin Equity Partners (Feb 2025). 30%+ YoY revenue growth since 2021. 100+ financial institution customers including HSBC, State Street. Napier Continuum platform for screening and monitoring.

name: Silent Eight
tagline: AI for sanctions and name screening
summary: Silent Eight is an AI platform for sanctions and name screening. Singapore-based. Raised $61.2M total ($40M Series B March 2022 led by TYH Ventures with HSBC, SC Ventures). 107 employees. Clients include AIA (April 2024), Mashreq, ADIB (June 2024). Named Celent Technology Standout 2024. Iris AI platform processes compliance alerts across multiple jurisdictions.

name: Kount (Equifax)
summary: Kount is an AI fraud prevention platform acquired by Equifax for $640M in Feb 2021. Identity Trust Global Network links 32B digital interactions, 17B devices, and 5B annual transactions across 200 countries. Serves 9,000+ brands and payment providers. $60M+ annualized revenue at acquisition with 20%+ growth. Founded 2007 in Boise.

name: Riskified
summary: Riskified (NYSE: RSKD) provides AI-powered fraud prevention and chargeback guarantees for ecommerce merchants. Revenue reached $328M in 2024, up 10% YoY, while achieving first full year of positive adjusted EBITDA. Named to CNBC's World's Top Fintech Companies in 2024. Launched Adaptive Checkout combining fraud detection with conversion optimization. Repurchased 27M shares for $141M in 2024. Serves many of the world's largest online retailers.

name: Forter
summary: Forter provides real-time fraud prevention using AI to verify consumer identity across digital commerce. Valued at $3B after raising $525M from Tiger Global, Bessemer, and Sequoia. Processes $1T+ in transactions with 1.5B identities in its network. Serves 10K customers including Nordstrom, Sephora, Adobe, SHEIN, and Instacart. Founded by ex-PayPal Fraud Sciences engineers. Revenue reached $103M in 2024.

name: Heron Finance
summary: Heron Finance is the first robo-advisor for private credit investing. San Francisco-based. $5K minimum investment for accredited investors. Access to 12 private credit funds, 3,000+ underlying loans. Delivered 9.5% net returns vs 9.0% peer average. Serves individual accredited investors, RIAs, and family offices. Platform customizes portfolios across institutional-grade private credit funds.

name: Instead
tagline: AI-powered tax platform for accountants, automating tax preparation
summary: Instead is an AI tax platform that automates tax preparation for accountants. Launched June 2023. First new platform to receive IRS e-file approval in decades (1040, 1041, 1120, 1120S, 1065). Strategic investment from IRIS Software Group (May 2025). Aims to automate 90%+ of tax prep with agentic AI. Plans from $16/month. Called 'first true disruption in tax since 1993.'

name: Fyle (Sage)
tagline: AI-powered expense management and GST compliance
summary: Fyle is an AI-powered expense management platform. Founded 2016. Raised $15.4M from Tiger Global, Steadview, Pravega. Acquired by Sage (July 2025) for undisclosed amount. 150+ employees, 1,600+ direct US customers. Conversational AI for receipt submission via text. Now branded as Sage Expense Management.

name: April Tax Solutions
tagline: AI-powered embedded tax engine for fintech platforms
summary: April is an AI-powered embedded tax platform for fintech apps. Founded 2022 by Daniel Marcous (Waze CTO) and Ben Borodach. Raised $78M total ($38M Series B July 2025 led by QED, Nyca Partners). First new company in 15+ years to achieve national e-file coverage. 22-minute avg filing time. 50+ partners, tripled business size in 2025. Targets $15B US tax market.

name: Heard Technologies
tagline: AI bookkeeping and tax prep for therapists
summary: Heard is a bookkeeping and tax platform built specifically for therapists. Founded 2019 in San Francisco by Andrew Riesen and Victoria Li. Raised $25M+ total ($15M June 2023, $10M May 2022). Done-for-you monthly bookkeeping, quarterly tax estimates, annual tax filing, payroll. Plans from $169/month. Serves solo providers and group practices in mental health.

name: Reducto
tagline: AI document parsing with agentic OCR for finance
summary: Reducto is an AI document parsing platform combining OCR with Vision-Language Models. Founded 2023 by MIT alums Adit Abraham and Raunak Chowdhuri. Raised $108M total: $8.4M seed (Oct 2024), $24.5M Series A (April 2025 led by Benchmark), $75M Series B (Oct 2025 led by a16z). Processes ~1B pages monthly. Customers include Harvey, Rogo, Scale AI, Fortune 10 enterprises.

name: Affinda
tagline: AI document extraction for HR and finance
summary: Affinda is an AI document extraction platform for HR and finance. Founded 2013 in Melbourne by Ben Toner (cousin of former OpenAI board member Helen Toner). Raised $22.9M total ($10M June 2024 at $120M valuation). Bootstrapped first decade. 1,500+ customers in 75 countries including SEEK, Deloitte, Korn Ferry. 150-200% annual revenue growth. Acquired Pathfindr for $15M (late 2025).

name: Klippa (SER Group)
summary: Klippa is an AI invoice and document processing platform. Founded 2015 in Groningen, Netherlands. Raised $1.5M. Acquired by SER Group (March 2025) for intelligent content automation. Won DM Award 2024 for DocHorizon platform. Deloitte 50 fastest-growing NL company 3 years running. 1,000+ clients in 25 countries.

name: Docsumo
tagline: AI for bank statements and invoice extraction
summary: Docsumo is an AI platform for bank statement and invoice extraction. Founded 2019 by Bikram Dahal and Rushabh Sheth. Raised $3.7M total ($3.5M seed March 2022 led by Common Ocean with Fifth Wall, Arbor Realty Trust). 34 employees. 98%+ accuracy, 90%+ straight-through processing. Clients include Arbor, National Debt Relief. Barclays accelerator alum.

name: Rossum
summary: Rossum is an AI document processing platform serving 275+ enterprise businesses. Raised $109.5M total including $100M Series A from General Catalyst. Hit $44.9M revenue in 2024 with 167 employees. IDC MarketScape Leader 2023-2024. Coupa certified. Partners include KPMG Netherlands. Founded 2017 in Prague by PhD researchers.

name: Instabase
summary: Instabase provides AI-powered unstructured document processing for banking, insurance, and healthcare. Raised $100M Series D (Jan 2025) from Qatar Investment Authority at $1.24B valuation. Revenue exceeded $50M in 2024. ~45 enterprise customers including Uber, NatWest, AXA, USPTO. Average contract value ~$1M. Founded 2015 by Anant Bhardwaj.

name: Nanonets
tagline: Trainable AI OCR for finance documents
summary: Nanonets is an AI OCR platform for finance document automation. Founded by IIT Gandhinagar alums (CEO Sarthak Jain). Raised $42M total ($29M Series B March 2024 led by Accel). 90% straight-through processing rate. 34%+ of Fortune 500 as customers. Users quadrupled in past year. Uses transformers over LLMs to avoid hallucinations. Angel investors include Ashton Kutcher.

name: Veryfi
summary: Veryfi is an AI-powered expense and receipt capture platform. Founded 2017 in San Mateo by Ernest Semerda and Dmitry Birulia. Raised $18.9M total ($12M Series A April 2021 led by NewView Capital). 55 employees. Forbes #1 Best Receipt Scanner 2025. Customers include Navan, PepsiCo, Rippling, Mercury. Y Combinator alum. OEM provider to top spend management software companies.

name: DocuClipper
tagline: AI for bank statements and reconciliation
summary: DocuClipper is an AI platform for bank statement conversion and reconciliation. California-based, bootstrapped. Trusted by 10,000+ financial professionals. 99.6% accuracy converting PDFs from 10,000+ financial institutions to Excel/CSV/QBO. AI-powered fraud detection and document authentication. Reduces processing costs by 80%. Custom rules engine automates GL coding and vendor matching.

name: Heron Data
tagline: AI document intake for lending and insurance
summary: Heron Data is an AI platform automating document workflows for lending and insurance. Founded 2020, HQ NYC/London. Raised $23.3M total ($16M Series A July 2025 led by Insight Partners with YC, BoxGroup). 150+ customers including FDIC banks. Processes 350K+ docs/week. Tripled revenue in 2024. Team from Facebook, Spotify, N26, Revolut. Cuts manual work 95%.

name: Mindee
tagline: AI document parsing with open-source docTR
summary: Mindee is an AI document parsing platform and creator of open-source docTR library. Paris/SF-based. Raised $23.4M total ($7M Series A March 2023). Won 'Best Handwriting Recognition' 2024 AI Breakthrough Awards. Launched docTI for any document in any language without training. Investors include GGV Capital, Alven, Serena Capital. docTR joined PyTorch ecosystem.

name: ABBYY
summary: ABBYY provides intelligent document processing and process mining used by 10,000+ companies including many Fortune 500 firms. Reported 60% ARR growth in 2023 from its purpose-built AI solutions. Named Leader in 2024 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Process Mining and Everest Group's IDP PEAK Matrix. Partners include Blue Prism, PwC, Deloitte, and NICE. Headquarters in Austin with offices in 13 countries.

name: Hyperscience
summary: Hyperscience is an AI document processing platform with $439M total funding including $100M Series E (2021) from Tiger Global. Record Q1 2024 ARR with strong retention. Forrester Wave Leader (Q2 2024) and IDC MarketScape Leader 2024. Customers include AmEx, Charles Schwab, Fidelity, US Social Security, and UK HMRC. Founded 2014 in NYC.

name: Eigen Technologies (Sirion)
tagline: AI for complex financial document extraction
summary: Eigen Technologies provides AI document extraction for financial services. Acquired by Sirion (CLM platform) in June 2024. Raised $60M+ from Goldman Sachs, Temasek, Lakestar. Trained on 22M real-world documents; Goldman gave 1M domain-specific docs. Processes 1,500 documents/day straight-through. Founded 2015 by Dr. Lewis Liu (Harvard/Oxford PhD).

name: Kofax (Tungsten)
summary: Kofax (now Tungsten Automation) is an intelligent automation platform for document processing. Irvine-based, founded 1985. Rebranded Jan 2024. Acquired by Clearlake Capital and TA Associates (2022) from Thoma Bravo. 2,200 employees, 32 countries, 25,000+ customers. Leader in 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Intelligent Document Processing.

name: Extract Systems
summary: Extract Systems is an AI document extraction platform for healthcare and government. Madison, WI-based, founded 1998. Acquired by Vyne Medical. ~$4M revenue, 18 employees. Uses ML and OCR for data extraction, redaction, classification. Serves clients across 41 US states. Automates unstructured medical records, purchase orders, government documents.

name: Parascript
tagline: AI for check and payment processing
summary: Parascript is an AI platform for check and payment processing. Boulder, CO-based. Processes 100B+ documents annually. Products: CheckXpert.AI (99% automation rates), CheckStock.AI for fraud detection. Won 2026 BIG Innovation Award. Expanded to African market via BIRGER partnership (2025). Reduces data entry costs 80%+. Serves banks, governments, corporations globally.

name: WorkFusion
summary: WorkFusion provides AI agents for financial crime compliance, handling AML, sanctions screening, KYC, and transaction monitoring. Deployed at 10 of the top 20 global banks; automates 1M+ alert hits and saves 5,000 FTEs daily. Raised $45M in 2024 led by Georgian, bringing total funding to $340M+. Customers include Raymond James, Valley Bank, and LPL Financial. Named Leader in Chartis RiskTech Quadrant for KYC Data Solutions 2024.

name: Tidalwave
summary: Tidalwave is an agentic AI mortgage point-of-sale platform. Founded 2023 by Diane Yu (ex-Better.com CTO), Jack Deng, Cheng Li. Raised $24M total ($22M Series A Nov 2025 led by Permanent Capital with D.R. Horton). Powers 200K+ loans annually (~4% of US mortgage market). Integrations with Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, Plaid. Customers include DHI Mortgage, NEXA Lending, First Colony.

name: Ridley
tagline: AI platform for selling homes without commission
summary: Ridley is an AI platform for selling homes without agent commissions. Founded by Mike Chambers. Launched July 2025 in Colorado. Raised $6.4M seed (Dec 2025) led by Fifth Wall with 1984 Ventures. $999 base fee for AI-guided selling. $150M+ in properties listed. Users saved avg $25K in commissions (up to $135K). Partnered with Thumbtack for services.

name: OpenSpace
summary: OpenSpace is a construction visual intelligence platform capturing and analyzing job site progress. Raised $199M total including $102M Series D at $902M valuation. ~$57M annual revenue (2023). 275K+ users across 94 countries with 43B+ sq ft captured. Acquired Disperse (Nov 2025). Founded 2017 in San Francisco.

name: Infogrid
summary: Infogrid is an AI platform for building sustainability and decarbonization. London-based, founded 2018. Raised $103M+ total: $90M Series B (April 2023) from SoftBank Vision Fund 2, Original Capital + $13M extension (April 2024) led by Keyframe Capital. IoT sensors + AI for ESG compliance reporting. Buildings account for 37% of global carbon emissions. Top 10 global climate tech company.

name: Lofty AI
summary: Lofty AI is a tokenized fractional real estate platform on Algorand blockchain. Miami-based, founded 2018 by Jerry Chu. YC-backed. Pivoted from neighborhood prediction to democratizing property ownership. 148 properties tokenized across 11 US states. ~7K monthly active users. $2M+ rental income distributed. $50 minimum investment. Vision: 'NASDAQ for real estate.'

name: OJO Labs
summary: OJO Labs is an AI conversational assistant for real estate. Austin-based, founded 2015 by John Berkowitz and David Rubin. Raised $134M total ($62.5M Series D June 2020 led by Wafra). Acquired by Lower (May 2025). Sold Canadian ops to RBC (Feb 2023) for $200M. Investors include Northwestern Mutual, Silverton Partners, LiveOak Venture Partners.

name: Vero
summary: Vero is an AI fraud screening platform for multifamily leasing. Founded 2018. VERO1 centralized screening launched 2023, nationwide rollout Sept 2025. Partners include Camden, Gables Residential, GoldOller, Asset Living. Replaces multiple screening tools (RealPage, Snappt, Checkpoint ID) with unified risk assessment. Competes with Snappt in $35B+ fraud detection market.

name: Prop-AI
summary: Prop-AI is an AI platform for real estate investment decisions. Dubai-based, founded 2023 by Ranime El Skaff and Christian Kunz. Raised $1.5M pre-seed led by Plus VC, Plug & Play, Joa Capital. Vision: 'Bloomberg of Real Estate.' Aggregates 3B+ data points. First PropTech to receive Dubai AI Centre Seal of Excellence. Expanding MENA and Europe.

name: LeaseAI
summary: LeaseAI is an AI platform for predictive leasing analytics. Raised $50M Series B. Helps property owners optimize tenant placement and retention. Advanced algorithms provide actionable insights into market trends and tenant preferences. Part of the $3.2B AI-powered proptech investment wave in 2024.

name: Rentlytics (RealPage)
tagline: AI analytics for multifamily real estate
summary: Rentlytics is an AI analytics platform for multifamily real estate. SF-based, founded 2013. Raised $13.2M from Bessemer Venture Partners, Bonfire Ventures. Acquired by RealPage for $57M (Oct 2018). Added 900K units of real-time data to RealPage analytics. Provides operational and renovation visibility for property owners and managers.

name: Reonomy (Altus Group)
tagline: AI commercial real estate data platform
summary: Reonomy is a commercial real estate data platform acquired by Altus Group in Nov 2021. Raised $128M including $60M Series D (2019) from Georgian, Wells Fargo, Citi Ventures. Covers 54M+ commercial parcels across the US. Uses ML to connect fragmented CRE data for investors and brokers. Founded in NYC.

name: Cherre
tagline: AI real estate data management platform
summary: Cherre is a real estate data management platform powering $3.3T AUM globally. Raised $30M Series C (Sept 2024) from HighSage, Nuveen Real Estate, RXR; $130M total. 7 of top 10 institutional investors use Cherre. Uses proprietary Knowledge Graph and Semantic Data Layer. Strategic partnership with Nuveen ($147B AUM). Founded 2016 in NYC.

name: Receeve (InDebted)
summary: Receeve is an AI-native debt collection platform. Hamburg-based, founded 2019 by Paul Jozefak. Raised $18M from ABN AMRO, Mangrove, Speedinvest, Seedcamp. Acquired by InDebted (Dec 2024). Partnership with TransUnion (Aug 2024). Full-stack digital debt servicing with AI automation.

name: CollectWise
summary: CollectWise is automating consumer debt collection with AI. SF-based, founded 2024 by Sean O'Brien and Vivek Isukapalli. YC F24 batch. Raised $500K seed (Jan 2025). AI agents outperform human collectors by 2X at 75% lower cost. Serviced $2M+ in debts. 20-day avg recovery time, 5% starting contingency fee. $35B US market.

name: Collectly
summary: Collectly is an AI-powered patient billing and revenue cycle platform. SF-based, founded 2017 by Levon Brutyan and Max Mizotin. Raised $34.1M total ($29M Series A July 2023 led by Sapphire Ventures, YC). Improves collections 75%, DSO to 12 days. 3,000+ healthcare orgs, $1B+ payments processed. Launched Billie AI voice agent (2025). SOC 2, HITRUST, HIPAA compliant.

name: LiveVox (NICE)
summary: LiveVox is an AI contact center platform for collections. Acquired by NICE for $3.74/share (closed Dec 2023). Contributed $142M to NICE revenue in 2024. Powers billions of omnichannel interactions/year via proactive outreach. 20+ years of CX expertise. Combined with NICE CXone to create 'conversational AI powerhouse.' Previously listed on Nasdaq.

name: FICO Debt Manager
summary: FICO Debt Manager is an enterprise AI collections optimization platform from FICO (NYSE: FICO). Customers include Cox Communications, Česká Spořitelna, EnterCard, Raiffeisen Bank, Valor Intelligence. Delivers 15% bad debt reduction, 50% collections cost reduction typical. Version 9.5 ensures regulatory compliance. Supports credit cards, mortgages, secured/unsecured loans.

name: Beyond ARM
summary: Beyond ARM is a debt collection and receivables management platform from DAKCS Software Systems. Cloud-based and on-premises deployment options. Features include credit/risk scoring, predictive dialing, reporting, and analytics. Serves accounts receivable management, financial services, government, healthcare, legal, consumer and commercial lending companies.

name: My DSO Manager
summary: My DSO Manager is a credit management and cash collection SaaS platform. Based in Meylan, France. Bootstrapped success story - international leader without VC funding. 2,100+ companies in 89 countries. Managed €100B+ in receivables. €4M+ revenue. Customers include Schneider Electric, Veolia, Rexel, Aéroports de Paris. AI cash forecasting with MAIA generative AI.

name: YayPay (Quadient)
summary: YayPay is an AI-powered accounts receivable automation platform. NYC-based, founded 2015. Acquired by Quadient for $20M+ (July 2020). 3,000+ users globally. Now Quadient AR by YayPay. Named IDC MarketScape Leader for Midmarket AR Automation. Combines automated invoice delivery, collections management, credit assessment, payment and cash application.

name: Esker
summary: Esker provides AI-powered source-to-pay and order-to-cash automation. $235M revenue in 2024, up from $189M (2023). 6K customers including NVIDIA, Sony, Heineken. Only vendor in both Gartner Magic Quadrants for S2P and I2C (2024). Registered as official French e-invoicing partner (PDP). 1,000+ employees, founded 1985 in Lyon.

name: Versapay
summary: Versapay is an AR automation platform with 5M+ businesses on its payment network, up 5x in 18 months. $42M revenue (2024), up from $21M (2023). Processes $170B+ in annual payments and 110M transactions. 10K customers. Acquired by Great Hill Partners for $126M (2020). Reduces past-due invoices 30%. Founded 2006 in Toronto.

name: Gaviti
summary: Gaviti is an AI-powered B2B accounts receivable automation platform. Tel Aviv-based, founded 2017. Raised $11.5M total ($9M Series A April 2022 led by Flashpoint with Moneta VC, TAU Ventures). $6.6M revenue (2024), 34 employees. Customers include monday.com, EY, TWE, Hadco. Automates collections to accelerate cash flow for invoice-on-terms businesses.

name: Sylvera
summary: Sylvera rates voluntary carbon credits from AAA to D using machine learning to verify project quality. Raised $57M Series B in 2024 from Balderton, Index Ventures, and Fidelity, bringing total funding to $133M. Customers include Delta and Salesforce; partners with Carbonplace and BlueLayer. Covers 10,000+ carbon projects globally. Data shows 25% increase in high-quality credit retirements (BB+) in 2024.

name: Briink
tagline: AI document analysis for ESG teams
summary: Briink is an AI document analysis platform for ESG and sustainability teams. Berlin-based, founded 2021 by Tomas van der Heijden and Samuel King. Raised €3.85M seed (Sept 2024) co-led by EquityPitcher Ventures, 13books Capital. 40+ enterprise clients including Continental, Lightrock, Climate Bonds. AI achieves 90%+ accuracy on ESG data extraction.

name: Zevero
tagline: AI ESG disclosure and carbon accounting
summary: Zevero is an AI carbon accounting and ESG disclosure platform. London-based, founded 2021. Raised $7M seed (Sept 2024) from Spiral Capital, East Ventures. Acquired by LEVELUP Climate (April 2024). Launched ESG Disclosure Reporting (April 2025) - cuts reporting time 40%+, 90%+ accuracy. Supports B Corp, CDP, CSRD frameworks.

name: Treefera
summary: Treefera is an AI platform for forest carbon verification using satellite imagery. UK-based, founded by Jonathan Horn (ex-JP Morgan MD) and Caroline Grey (ex-UiPath CCO). Raised $44M+ total: $2.2M pre-seed (2023), $12M Series A (April 2024) led by AlbionVC, $30M Series B (June 2025). Maps 1T+ trees globally. 500+ forest projects monitored.

name: Arabesque
summary: Arabesque is an AI-powered ESG data and analytics group. Frankfurt-based. Arabesque S-Ray received $20M (Oct 2024) from DWS, Allianz X, Commerz Real, Hessen. ESG Book (formerly S-Ray) raised $35M Series B (June 2022) led by Energy Impact Partners. Uses ML for ESG performance assessment of 30,000+ companies globally.

name: Clarity AI
summary: Clarity AI provides sustainability analytics covering 30K+ companies and 200K+ funds. Valued at $450M after $50M round led by SoftBank Vision Fund 2 with BlackRock. Integrated natively with BlackRock's Aladdin platform. Serves clients managing $70T+ in assets including Nordea and Santander. Named Leader in Forrester Wave ESG Data & Analytics 2024. Acquired ecolytiq in 2025 for consumer-facing sustainability tools.

name: Persefoni
summary: Persefoni is a carbon accounting platform for enterprises and financial institutions. Raised $23M Series C (2025) and $50M Series C-1 from TPG Rise; $101M+ total. Free Persefoni Pro tier attracted 6K+ organic signups. Partners include Workiva, Deloitte, Bain. Singapore Exchange chose Persefoni for climate management. InsuranceERM Climate Solution of the Year 2024.

name: Watershed
summary: Watershed helps companies measure, report, and reduce carbon emissions. Founded by former Stripe engineers; valued at $1.8B after $100M Series C in 2024 led by Greenoaks ($239M total). Named to CNBC Disruptor 50. Customers include Stripe, BlackRock, Walmart, Visa, Spotify, 4 of the top 6 US banks, and 6 of the top 10 PE firms. Co-led by John Doerr and Michael Moritz—their first co-investment since Google in 1999.

name: Greenly
summary: Greenly is a carbon accounting platform for SMBs. Raised $52M Series B (2024) led by Fidelity, HSBC, HPE; tripled customer base to 3,500+ since 2022. $10M+ ARR. Partners with BNP Paribas to help SMBs get better funding terms via emissions reporting. HubSpot co-founder Brian Halligan invested. Founded 2019 in Paris.

name: Sweep
summary: Sweep is an enterprise carbon management platform. Raised $100M total including $73M Series B from Coatue and Tony Fadell's Future Shape. Customers include L'Oréal, Sanofi, HP, Saint Gobain. Verdantix Green Quadrant leading performer. EcoVadis Gold Rating (2024). Network approach helps decarbonize global supply chains. Founded 2020 in France.

name: Plan A
summary: Plan A is an AI-powered decarbonization and carbon accounting platform. Berlin-based, founded 2017. Raised €25.2M+ (Sept 2023) led by Lightspeed with Visa, Deutsche Bank, Opera Tech Ventures (BNP Paribas). 1,500+ customers including BMW, Deutsche Bank, KFC, Visa. 600%+ YoY revenue growth (2021-2022).

name: Normative
summary: Normative is an AI-powered carbon accounting platform. Stockholm-based, founded 2014 by Kristian Rönn. Raised $45.4M total (€31M Series B July 2022 led by Blume Equity, Horizons Ventures backed by Li Ka-shing). Acquired Eivee (Nov 2024). Clients include Zurich, Nordea, Vodafone. Partners with UN for sustainability intelligence.

name: Carbon Bright
summary: CarbonBright is an AI-powered instant Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) platform for consumer products. Provides instant Scope 3 emissions tracking across supply chains. Third-party verified accuracy. Automated reports for CSRD, SEC Climate Disclosure, PEF, EPDs, ISO 14067. Identifies emissions hotspots and suggests sustainable alternatives.

name: KEY ESG
summary: KEY ESG is an AI-driven ESG management platform for fund managers and companies. London-based, founded 2020 by Heleen Van Poecke and Anne-marie Schoonbeek. Raised $1.3M seed (Aug 2021) from AtlasInvest. Licensed EDCI (ESG Data Convergence Initiative) partner. Full Scope 1, 2, 3 carbon accounting with AI-assisted data collection.

name: Sphera
summary: Sphera is an AI-powered ESG and risk management platform. Chicago-based, founded 2016. Acquired by Blackstone for $1.4B. 8,400+ clients in 95 countries including Siemens, Mercedes-Benz, Danone. $300M+ annual revenue. Acquired riskmethods (2022), SupplyShift (2024). Neuberger Berman growth investment (Sept 2025). Blackstone exploring $3B sale.

name: Entelligent
summary: Entelligent is an AI climate risk analytics platform for investors. Boulder, CO-based, founded 2011 by David Schimel. Raised $19.4M total ($10.3M Series B July 2025). New CEO Pooja Khosla (July 2024). Patented climate scenario analysis + ML for ESG investments. Investors include Oak Creek Group, Societe Generale Capital Partenaires.

name: AiPrise
summary: AiPrise is an AI-powered global KYC/KYB compliance platform. YC S22 batch. Raised $12.5M Series A (Oct 2025) led by Headline with SixThirty, Correlation Ventures. 150+ global customers including Bridge (Stripe), D.Local. 40-person team. 80+ local registries across 150+ countries. Cuts compliance time by 95%.

name: Notabene
tagline: AI for crypto travel rule compliance
summary: Notabene is a crypto travel rule compliance platform - 'SWIFT for crypto.' Brooklyn, NY-based, founded 2020. Raised $14.5M Series B (Nov 2024) led by DRW Venture Capital with Apollo, Wintermute. 165 companies using platform including OKX, Copper, Ramp. Global presence in US, Switzerland, Singapore, Germany, UK. YC-backed.

name: Regula
tagline: AI document and face verification SDK
summary: Regula is a document and biometric verification SDK provider. Latvia-based. Recognized in 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Identity Verification. Face SDK v6.3 (Oct 2024) with improved liveness detection. First to verify all dynamic security features remotely (April 2025). Digital Travel Credential support (Jan 2025). Serves 230+ countries and territories.

name: Ekata
summary: Ekata is an AI-powered identity verification platform. Seattle-based, spun from Whitepages (July 2019). Acquired by Mastercard for $850M (2021). Ekata Identity Engine aggregates 1B+ identities for fraud prevention. 2,000+ enterprise clients including Sage, American Airlines, Equifax, Lyft. Now part of Mastercard's Cyber and Intelligence business.

name: Mitek
tagline: AI mobile document capture and verification
summary: Mitek (NASDAQ: MITK) provides mobile document capture and identity verification. FY2024 revenue $172M; Q4 revenue grew 15% YoY to $43M with 36% adjusted EBITDA margin. Trusted by 7,000+ organizations. Invented mobile check deposit (powers major US banks). $142M cash. Founded 1986 in San Diego.

name: IDnow
summary: IDnow is a European identity verification leader acquired by Corsair Capital for $295M (Jan 2025). $100M+ raised including €60M debt from BlackRock. Customers include UniCredit, BNP Paribas, Klarna, N26, Commerzbank, Sixt. German regulator approved VideoIdent for compliant KYC (2024). Founded 2014 in Munich.

name: iProov
summary: iProov provides facial biometric authentication for governments and enterprises globally. Customers include US Department of Homeland Security, UK NHS, UK Home Office, and Singapore GovTech. First biometrics vendor certified to NIST 800-63-4 standards. Raised $70M from Sumeru Equity Partners. Named Cool Vendor by Gartner and Innovation Leader by KuppingerCole. 2024 threat report tracked 2,665% increase in virtual camera attacks.

name: Trulioo
summary: Trulioo provides global KYC/KYB verification covering 5B consumers and 330M businesses through a single API. Reached unicorn status at $1.75B valuation after $394M Series D led by TCV in 2021. Total funding of $477M from Goldman Sachs, Citi Ventures, Santander, and others. Started serving Facebook in 2012; now trusted by leading fintechs and financial institutions. Acquired HelloFlow in 2022 for no-code onboarding.

name: GBG
summary: GBG (GB Group) is an AI identity verification and fraud prevention company. Chester, UK-based, founded 1989. LSE-listed FTSE 250 constituent. £282.7M revenue (FY March 2025). $820M market cap. Serves banking, gaming, insurance, retail. Launching GBG Go unified platform (2025). TMT ID partnership (April 2025). Identity Graph with billions of records.

name: LexisNexis Risk Solutions
summary: LexisNexis Risk Solutions (owned by RELX) provides identity verification and fraud prevention using 36B+ cross-industry transactions from 6,000+ contributing organizations. Acquired Emailage for $500M in 2020 and IDVerse in 2025. Combines physical and digital identity verification with deep learning to detect synthetic identities and deepfakes. Florida DCF avoided $843M+ in food stamp fraud using the platform.

name: Equifax Workforce Solutions
summary: Equifax Workforce Solutions operates The Work Number, the dominant US employment verification database. 781M+ records from 4.74M employers. Processed 149M verifications in 2024 (~400K/day), serving 6.4M auto loan applicants, 4.5M job candidates, 25.5M benefits seekers. Acquired via Talx for $1.4B in 2007. Verifications typically complete in under one second.

name: GTreasury
summary: GTreasury is a treasury management platform. Chicago-based, founded 1986. Acquired by Ripple for $1B (Oct 2025) - first crypto company to acquire TMS vendor. Processes $12.5T in payment volume annually. Acquired CashAnalytics (Sept 2024), Solvexia (Jan 2026). Previously owned by HgCapital Trust.

name: Nomentia
summary: Nomentia is a European leader in treasury and cash management. Helsinki-based. 1,400+ businesses in 80+ countries. Processes €1.2T+ annually. Launched AI Cash Flow Forecasting (April 2025). Expanded from Finland/Scandinavia across Europe. New CRO Huub Wevers leading growth initiative. Highest performing AI forecasting model for treasurers.

name: Embat
summary: Embat is an AI-powered corporate treasury platform. Madrid-based, founded 2021 by ex-JP Morgan Antonio Berga and Carlos Serrano. Raised $23M total (€14.7M Series A Feb 2024 led by Creandum). 150+ enterprise clients including Playtomic, Cabify, Wallapop, Fever. Acquired Necto (2025). Uses Google Vertex AI. Saves 75% treasury time.

name: Nilus
summary: Nilus is an AI-powered treasury management platform. NYC-based, founded 2021 by Daniel Kalish (ex-PayPal) and Danielle Shaul (ex-Fundbox). Raised $18.6M total ($10M Jan 2025 led by Felicis, Vesey Ventures, Bessemer). Customers include Alloy, Taboola, Planned Parenthood. LinkedIn Top Startup 2025. CTO Matthew Harlan (ex-Toast, Samsara).

name: Cashforce
tagline: AI cash flow forecasting and working capital
summary: Cashforce is an AI cash forecasting and working capital platform. Antwerp, Belgium-based. Raised $9.9M total (€5M Series A Oct 2019 led by INKEF Capital, Citi Ventures, BNP Paribas). Acquired by TIS (June 2022). Global presence: NYC, Antwerp, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, London. Serves multinationals in 120+ countries.

name: TIS (Treasury Intelligence)
summary: TIS (Treasury Intelligence Solutions) is a cloud-based corporate payments and cash management platform. Walldorf-based, founded 2010 by ex-SAP executives. Marlin Equity Partners acquired majority stake (March 2024). $35M revenue, 265 employees. Processes corporate payments for enterprise clients. Acquired Cashforce (Jan 2024) to add AI-powered cash forecasting. Partners with SAP, Coupa, Oracle.

name: Serrala
summary: Serrala provides AI-powered financial operations software for AR, AP, treasury, and payments. Hamburg-based, founded 1984. Acquired by Hg (Aug 2021). 2,500+ enterprise customers globally. Acquired Payference (July 2024) for AI cash forecasting. Launching unified Serrala Finance Platform (2025). Integrates with SAP, Oracle, Microsoft. Offices in 15 countries, 700+ employees.

name: Refinitiv Eikon
summary: Refinitiv Eikon is a market data and analytics desktop platform, now LSEG Data & Analytics. LSEG acquired Refinitiv for $27B (Jan 2021). Eikon platform retired June 2025, replaced by LSEG Workspace. 40,000+ customers, 400,000+ end users, data from 190+ markets. Competes with Bloomberg Terminal. Real-time pricing, news, analytics for trading and research professionals.

name: Bloomberg Treasury
summary: Bloomberg Treasury is part of Bloomberg Professional Services, offering treasury and risk analytics via the MARS platform. 8,000+ corporations worldwide use Bloomberg for treasury management. Customers include Danone, KBR, U.S. Steel, LeasePlan, Nordea. Provides cash management, liquidity analytics, FX risk hedging, and debt management integrated with Bloomberg Terminal data.

name: Hazeltree
summary: Hazeltree provides cloud-based treasury and liquidity management for alternative asset managers. 500+ firms with $4T+ client assets process ~$8B daily transactions across 10K+ funds. Customers include Carlyle, Bain Capital, Ares, Hamilton Lane, Oak Hill, EQT. Launched v11 platform enhancements (2024). Founded in NYC.

name: Adenza
summary: Adenza was formed by Thoma Bravo combining Calypso ($3.7B acquisition, 2021) and AxiomSL ($2B acquisition, 2020), then acquired by Nasdaq for $10.5B in Nov 2023. Now a division of Nasdaq powering Capital Markets Technology and Regulatory Technology. Serves global banks and asset managers with risk, treasury, and compliance software.

name: Finbar
tagline: AI investment analyst for hedge funds
summary: Finbar is an AI investment analyst used by several top-20 AUM hedge funds. YC-backed (W25). Founded 2023 by Edward (ex-Balyasny, ex-Goldman Sachs, CFA charterholder) with Robin (ex-Thought Machine) as CTO. Automates financial modelling, research, and data analysis. Claims 100x faster multi-million-dollar investment decisions. Live with several multi-billion AUM hedge funds.

name: Keye
tagline: AI for private equity due diligence
summary: Keye is an AI-powered due diligence platform for private equity. NYC-based, YC F24 batch. Raised $5M seed (July 2025) from Sorenson Capital, General Catalyst, YC, ERA. Founded by Conor and Rohan (ex-Vista Equity, Goldman Sachs, Natixis) with 14 years combined PE experience and $20B+ transaction experience. CTO Lalit led teams at three AI companies. Converts raw deal files into structured, audit-ready analyses.

name: Trata
tagline: AI research desk for hedge funds
summary: Trata is an AI-powered research desk providing anonymous buyside research from hedge fund analysts. SF-based, YC W25 batch. Raised $500K seed. Founded 2024 by Eric Cho (4.5 years Senior Analyst at L/S hedge fund, Sohn Idea Contest Finalist), Will Gao (UChicago PhD, ex-Meta, Nvidia, Adobe Research), and Alex Chen (ex-Titan, Medallion, Oscar Health). AI agents interview analysts at multi-billion dollar funds and publish anonymously.

name: FundGuard
summary: FundGuard provides AI-powered fund accounting and investment administration for asset managers and fund administrators. Raised $100M Series C in 2024 from Key1 Capital and Hamilton Lane at 50%+ higher valuation, bringing total funding to $150M+. Strategic investors include Citi and State Street. Customers include Gryphon Fund Group, Brevan Howard, and Ultimus Fund Solutions. Named Top 10 Israeli Startup by CTech in 2024.

name: Orbital Insight
summary: Orbital Insight analyzes satellite imagery for investment insights like retail traffic, oil storage levels, and supply chain activity. Acquired by Steve Wozniak's Privateer in 2024 after raising $130M from Sequoia, GV, and Lux Capital. Developed Global Geospatial Crude Index tracking 25,000 oil tanks daily. Customers included RBC Capital Markets and Mitsubishi. TerraScope platform now integrated into Privateer's Wayfinder engine.

name: Quiver Quantitative
summary: Quiver Quantitative is an alternative data platform democratizing hedge fund-level data for retail investors. Spring Green, WI-based, founded 2020 by twin brothers James and Christopher Kardatzke (graduated UW in 2 years). Raised $2.52M total ($2M Series A March 2022 led by Allos Ventures, Alumni Ventures, M25). Tracks Congress stock trading, corporate lobbying, and WallStreetBets sentiment. Freemium model at $20/mo or $200/year.

name: Atom Finance
summary: Atom Finance was a retail investment research platform acquired by Toggle/Reflexivity in May 2024. Raised $51M including $28M Series B from SoftBank (2021) at $150M valuation. Offered institutional-quality research tools to individual investors. Founded 2018 in NYC by Eric Shoykhet and Edward Lando. Backed by General Catalyst.

name: FactSet
summary: FactSet (NYSE: FDS) provides financial data and analytics to 9,000+ clients and 237K+ investment professionals. Annual revenue of $2.2B with $17B market cap. Serves 95 of top 100 asset managers and ~75% of top 50 investment banks. Launched industry's first production-grade MCP server in 2025 for AI-ready financial data. 95%+ annual retention rate. Investing in generative AI for transcript analysis and research workflows.

name: S&P Capital IQ
summary: S&P Capital IQ (now Capital IQ Pro) is S&P Global Market Intelligence's flagship research platform. Market Intelligence segment generated $4.65B revenue in 2024 (+6% YoY), largest segment at ~20% of S&P Global total. Covers 109K+ public companies and 58M+ private companies. 98% customer satisfaction. Used across 195 countries in 21+ industries.

name: Rippling
summary: Rippling provides a unified HR, IT, and finance platform built around a single employee graph. Valued at $16.8B after $450M Series G in 2025; $1.85B total funding from Founders Fund, Greenoaks, and Coatue. Revenue hit $570M in 2025, up from $350M in 2023. Serves 20K+ customers including Coinbase and Superhuman. Employer of Record available in 80 countries. Founded by Parker Conrad (Zenefits co-founder).

name: Kaito AI
summary: Kaito AI is a crypto-focused search engine that indexes thousands of datasets to solve information fragmentation. Raised $10.8M from Dragonfly Capital and Sequoia China. Launched YAPS points program in December 2024 as a proof-of-attention mechanism rewarding quality content. KAITO token launched February 2025 on Binance HODLer Airdrops. 56.67% of tokens allocated to community and ecosystem.

name: Modulus Labs
summary: Modulus Labs builds zero-knowledge proofs for on-chain AI verification (zkML). SF-based, founded 2021. Raised $6.3M seed from Variant, 1kx, Bankless. Angels include Ethereum Foundation, Worldcoin, Polygon, Solana, Microsoft. Acquired by Tools for Humanity (Dec 2024) to boost ZK-AI cryptography research. Open-sourced codebase with Modulus API. Enables trustless verification of AI model execution on blockchain.

name: EQTY Lab
summary: EQTY Lab provides AI Integrity Suite and AI Guardian for verifiable AI governance. LA-based, founded 2022 by Jonathan Dotan. Funded by Further Ventures. Released ClimateGPT on Hugging Face with Hedera integration (Jan 2024). Verifiable Compute AI framework with Intel and NVIDIA (Dec 2024). Joined Confidential Computing Consortium (May 2025). Partners with Hedera and Accenture for public sector AI governance.

name: Vana
summary: Vana is a user-owned data network for AI training. Raised $25M total: $18M Series A from Paradigm, $5M strategic from Coinbase Ventures. Originated from MIT research (2018).
